tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Letourneux, 1879”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Nahr ez Zaïr (Liban)” [locality not found], Lebanon.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 245) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lampra Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Akseri Ifesfassen à Imouzer d’Agadir” [Aïn Akseri Ifesfassen at Imouzzer near Agadir], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “brachyptychia” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2682) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Près de Villa de Barra” [near Villa de Barra, province Bahia], Brazil.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Currently considered to belong in the genus Hemisinus Swainson, 1840 (Thiaridae) (Nuttall 1990: 244).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Graben hinter der Kirche von Podwin; [...] Graben zwischen der Čapla und Podwin; [...] Čapla; [...] Gromačnik; [...] Strassengraben zwischen Gromačnik und Sibin; [...] Cigelnik” [ditch behind the church of Podvinje; Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod; Čaplja; Gromačnik; roadside ditch between Gromačnik and Sibinj; Ciglenik], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Breasta, à Bocovatz, à Glodu et à Bâzdâna, dans la vallée de Jiu, et à Beceni, dans la vallée de Slanic, district de Buzau” [at Breasta, at Bucovăț, at Glodu and at Bâzdâna, in the valley of the river Jiu, and at Beceni, in the valley of the river Slănic, Buzau county], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Agouraï, Aïn Mahrouf” [Agourai, Oued Ain Maarouf], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: After Cossmann (1909: 153) this species belongs in the genus Coptostylus Sandberger, 1872 (Thiaridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les eaux de l’ancien Léonthes” [in the Litani river], Lebanon.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis brevis Sowerby, 1826. Blanckenhorn (1897) introduced Melanopsis maroccana media as replacement name (see also Melanopsis moussoni Pallary, 1916). The authority is clear from the discussion provided in Mousson (1854); in fact, Mousson even seemed to doubt the specific separation of this taxon from other melanopsids.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis brevis Sowerby, 1826. Pallary (1916: 81) introduced Melanopsis moreleti as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis brevis Sowerby, 1826. Pallary (1916: 81) introduced Melanopsis abbreviata as replacement name, which is itself a junior homonym of Melanopsis abbreviata Brusina, 1874 (see Melanopsis doncieuxi Wenz, 1919 and Melanopsis atacica Wenz, 1928).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Navajas (Castellón), Alcudia, Alberrique, Jativa (Valencia)” [Navajas, L’Alcúdia, Alberic, Xàtiva (prov. Valencia)], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis brevis Sowerby, 1826. Not available from Rossmässler (1854), to whom Pallary referred to, because he did not use the term “brevis” to denote a species-group taxon but only cited Férussac’s (1823) description of an unnamed variety of Melanopsis dufourii.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not stated in Papp and Thenius (1952), but specified by Papp (1955) as “Angelocastron, (Agrinion)” [Angelókastro], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens; no number indicated (Papp 1955).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Although probably unintentionally, Papp and Thenius (1952) briefly described and thus validly introduced the taxon. The spelling “brevisesta” is probably a lapsus calami for “brevitesta” (Latin for “short shell”), as used in the re-description by Papp (1955: 126, pl. 20, figs 10–14). Nevertheless, “brevisesta” is the correct name following Art. 32.5.1 and “brevitesta” is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania buccinoidea sensu Briart & Cornet, 1873, “non Férussac” (actually it should read “non Olivier, 1801”).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania buccinoidea sensu Briart & Cornet, 1873, “non Férussac” (actually it should read “non Olivier, 1801”). Junior homonym, as well as junior objective synonym of Melanopsis briarti Cossmann, 1888. Obviously, Munier-Chalmas overlooked that the name had already been introduced for the very same misidentified taxon by Cossmann.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2879) considered it a junior synonym of Ptychomelania buccinella Sacco, 1895 (Thiaridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Pylle und Antimachia” [between Pýli and Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary (1925) and Wenz (1929) erroneously referred to it as homonym of “Melanopsis broti” Gassies, 1874, which was actually introduced as Melanopsis brotiana. The replacement name Melanopsis cosiana Pallary, 1925 is thus invalid as it is a junior objective synonym (see also Willmann 1981).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Conception, prope Noumea” [Conception, near Nouméa], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Currently considered to belong in the genus Verena H. Adams & A. Adams, 1854 (Thiaridae) (Nuttall 1990: 256). The name “browni” as given by Nuttall (1990) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym and junior synonym of Melanopsis brusinai Lörenthey, 1902 (see Neubauer et al. 2014a: 462).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2813) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis pygmaea Hörnes, 1856.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De Scio, de presque toutes les îles de l’Archipel, de Crète, de Syrie” [from Chios, from almost all islands of the Archipelago, from Crete (Greece), from Syria].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Today combined as Melanopsis buccinoidea, the species is one of the few stable taxa in melanopsid taxonomy (e.g., Glaubrecht 1996).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Perhaps unaware of Melleville’s publication, Deshayes (1862: 469, pl. 31, figs 11–13) erroneously described this species as new: he marked the name with “Desh.”, provided a Latin diagnosis and did not list any citations. Judging from the illustrations in both works, Deshayes’ species is undoubtedly the same as Melleville’s. Moreover, both were recorded from the same locality (Châlons-sur-Vesles).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’O.[ued] Ida ou Guert, près de Mogador” [Wadi Ida Ou Gourdh at Essaouira], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2506-152/1-3 (Milan et al. 1974: 87).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Познат за сега само от р. Дунав, северно от гр. Лом” [from the river Danube, near the city of Lom], Bulgaria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Angelov (2000: 15), while incorrectly treating the name as nomen nudum, considered the species as a junior synonym of Amphimelania holandri [sic] (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not indicated, probably in the Middle East.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced in synonymy of Melania costata by Kobelt (1879), referring to an “in schedis” name by Parreyss. Dautzenberg (1894) made the name available by treating it as valid name (see Note 2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rodi: colline sulla sinistra del fiume Dimilia” [Rhodes island: hills on the left bank of the river Dimilia], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans l’intérieur de la grotte du Nahr-el-Kelb, près de Beyrouth (Syrie)” [in the cave of Nahr el-Kalb near Beirut], Lebanon.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sadjour-Sou entre Ain-Taïb et Alep” [at Sadjour-Sou between Gaziantep (Turkey) and Aleppo (Syria)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 243) tentatively considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name appeared first as nomen nudum in Genth (1848: 198–199), Sandberger (1850: 18; 1851: 676; 1852: 684) and Braun in Walchner (1851: 1126). Wenz (1929: 2764) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fritzei Thomä, 1845.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally given as “Sinj” and later specified as “Župića potok” in Brusina (1884b), Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 87) stated that Brusina (1897) had indicated one of the specimens illustrated by him (pl. 5, figs 1–2) as type. However, it is uncertain whether the specimen actually derives from the original type series. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2980-626/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Danube à Ibraïla” [Danube river at Brăila], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Colognole e al casino Cubbe; [...] presso il casino Sant’Andrea sotto Colognole” (Capellini 1880: 397) [at Colognole and at Casa Cubbe; near Casa Sant’Andrea below Colognole”, Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for “Melanopsis dufourii var. a” in Capellini, 1880. Pallary used multiple original spellings (“capelliniana”, “capelliana”) but according to 32.5.1 the name must be capelliniana. Wenz (1929: 2785) considered Capellini’s material synonymous with Melanopsis narzolina Manzoni, 1870.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species epithet is a noun in apposition and needs not to agree in gender with the generic name (Art. 31.2.1). Wenz (1929: 2718) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Au ravin de Tura, à Capatzineni; [...] aussi à Salatrucu-Mare” [in the ravine of Tura in Căpățânenii; also at Sălătrucu], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Из Рамаће” [from the village Ramača (near Ripanj)], Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 796 (Milošević 1962: 23).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In a well near Newport, Isle of Wight; [...] from Hampstead Cliff to Cowes, and [...] on the opposite Cliffs of Hampshire”, United Kingdom.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Diahot, à Balade; à Jengen, à Kanala, dans les marais et les petits ruisseaux” [in the Diahot river at Balade; at Hienghène, at Canala, in swamps and small streams], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826. Pallary (1916: 82) introduced Melanopsis ducosi as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Issel 1865 [page unknown; original work not seen; described on p. 400 of the re-published version from 1866].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Nel lago di Paleaston presso Poti” [Paliastomi Lake near Poti], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Obviously unaware of the fact that variety names are available in nomenclature as species-group names, Kormos (1903) stated that, if raised to species, he suggests “Melanopsis mucronifera” as name for the taxon. Both names were simultaneously published and are junior objective synonyms. Since carinata sensu Kormos is a junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826, Melanopsis mucronifera is the valid name of the taxon.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis staubi: Brusina (1903) indicated it as the typical form of the species. Junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Delle colline tortonesi presso S. Agata” [from the Torino hills near Sant’Agata Fossili], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not available from Oppenheim (1890b), where he gave it as “mutation”, which is not ruled by the provisions of the Code. In 1891 he introduced the name as “carinato-costata”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally introduced as infrasubspecific taxon (“subvariety”) by Nevill (1884), but made available by Paetel (1888) who treated it as variety (Art. 45.5.1). Paetel clearly referred to the description of Nevill.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In Aqaeductu ad Sevillam” [in an aqueduct near Sevilla], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Today combined as Melanopsis cariosa, the species is one of the few stable taxa in melanopsid taxonomy (e.g., Glaubrecht 1996).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The original type material of Brusina (1902) is lost. Neubauer et al. (2016c: 275–276) defined a neotype from the type locality. The specimen is stored in the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna, coll. no. 2014/010/0002.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2485-131/1-5 (Milan et al. 1974: 83).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. Férussac (1823: 149) listed it in synonymy of Melania buccinoidea var. α [= Melania buccinoidea (Olivier, 1801)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivière à Ostaria et à Ogulin (Croatie)” [river at Oštarije and at Ogulin], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De la Savina” [from the Savinja river], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ouakda, à 4 kil. N.-E. de Colomb-Béchar” [Ouakda, 4 km northeast of Bechar], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Given as “capula” on p. 580, but as “cepula” in the plate captions. Guppy (1867) acted as First Reviser and fixed the correct original spelling as “cepula” (Art. 24.2.3, 32.2.1). Guppy (1867) did not consider the species a melanopsid anymore and introduced the new genus Crepitacella (Rissoinidae) with Melanopsis cepula as type species.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Cossmann (1888: 279) classified the species in the genus Faunus Montfort, 1810 (Pachychilidae). Wenz (1929: 2637) apparently agreed with that classification but listed it a second time (p. 2563) in synonymy of Semisinus [= Hemisinus] resectus (Deshayes, 1834).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Plaine du Bahr-el-Houlé (haut Jourdain) dans l’Aïn-el-Mellaha” [in the plains of the Hula valley (upper Jordan), in Aïn Mallahah], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Given as “cerithiopis” in heading of description, but as “cerithiopsis” throughout the rest of the work. Heller et al. (2005: 248) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis transiens Cerulli-Irelli, 1914, non Blanckenhorn, 1897. Girotti (1972: 232) considered Melanopsis transiens Cerulli-Irelli, 1914 a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 88) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2991-637.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Mandic et al. (2015: 194) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis clavigera Neumayr in Neumayr & Paul, 1875.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879) atrributed the name to Parreyss, based on his “in schedis” determination.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le source de Yeni Chehir, [...] entre Antioche et Alep, à l’intersection de la route d’Alexandrette” [at the source of Yenişehir, between Antakya and Aleppo, at the intersection of the road from İskenderun], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Cheragrag, en Mésopotamie, entre Rakka, au Sud et Tell Abiad au Nord, sur la rive gauche du Karamouk Sou, affluent de la rive droite du Nahr Bâhlik” [Sharakrak in Mesopotamia, beteween Ar Raqqah in the south and Tall Abyaḑ in the north, on the left bank of the Qarah Mūkh, tributary of the right side of the Nahr al Balīkh], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 254) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis infracincta Martens, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’Abreuvoir de Dar-Beida” [water trough of Dar Beïda], southern Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aux environs de Biskra, à Ain-Oumach [...] dans une source d’eau chaude” [around Biskra, at Ain Oumache; in a hot spring], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary (1912: 14) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saharica Bourguignat, 1864.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Hatchetigbee, Butler, Choctaw County, Alabama”, United States.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Palmer and Brann (1966: 546) stated the the figured syntype was missing. A remaining syntype is stored in the collection of the National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, DC, coll. no. 638787.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Classified within the marine genus Bulliopsis Conrad, 1862 (Nassariidae) by Harris (1899: 58) and Allmon (1990: 53).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 88) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2504-150.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Pylle und Antimachia” [between Pýli and Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Willmann (1981: 179) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis delessei Tournouër, 1875.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Nahe am Gipfel des Plateaus des Randens” [near the top of the plateau of Mt. Randen], Switzerland.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Plate 25 of Sandberger’s monograph was issued in 1872, while the description on pp. 512, 521 appeared in 1875 (Woodward 1906). Introduced for Melanopsis aquensis sensu Hörnes, 1856, non Grateloup, 1838.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Cigelnik; [...] Graben zwischen Podwin und der Čapla; [...] Čapla; [...] An der Strasse von Sibin nach Gromačnik; [...] Gromačnik” [Ciglenik; Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod; Čaplja; at the road from Sibinj to Gromačnik; Gromačnik], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: A lectotype was designated by Fischer (1996b: 20). It is stored in the collection of the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Migliaska à Serajewo (Bosnie); Ostaria (Croatie)” [in the Miljacka river at Sarajevo (Bosnia and Herzegovina); Oštarije (Croatia)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Servain (1884).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Karlowitz [...] Görgetek in Syrmien” (Neumayr and Paul 1875: 49) [Karlovci; Grgeteg], Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 88) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3001-647.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for “Melanopsis cf. visianiana” in Neumayr and Paul, 1875, non Brusina, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les cours d’eau de la province de Murcie” [in rivers of the province Murcia], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Les marnes à Potamides Basteroti de Visan (Vaucluse)” [in the marls with Potamides basteroti in Visan, Dép. Vaucluse], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2793) considered the variety as a junior synonym Melanopsis neumayri Tournouër, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aït Taleb sur le Sefrou près d’el Menzel, avant l’oued Sebou” [Douar Ait Taleb at Sefrou near El Menzel, before the Sebou river], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis compacta Fontannes, 1880.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum (as “M. Conemenosi Bttg. in litt.”) in Oppenheim (1890b).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis fuchsi Brusina, 1884, non Handmann, 1882 and Melanopsis hungarica Pallary, 1916, non Kormos, 1904, which were in turn introduced for Melania costata sensu Fuchs, 1870, non Olivier, 1804 (see also Strausz 1942; Neubauer et al. 2014a).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis antediluviana (Poiret, 1801), which Bronn (1848) gave in synonymy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “conjungens” as mentioned in Sacco (1889: 68) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Forage Mihăița, profondeur 109 m” [borehole Mihăița, at a depth of 109 m], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Laboratory of Paleontology, Bucharest, coll. no. 651.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pană denoted the authorship as “Pană, 1989”. Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“conoideus”), but Melanopsis is feminine, which is why the name must be “conoidea”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 84).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2682) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei megacantha Handmann, 1887.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dax. St-Geours, Abesse” (Grateloup 1840: captions of the plate “Mollusques terrestres et fluviatiles fossiles de Dax”), France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Grateloup, 1840, for which d’Orbigny (1852) had already introduced Melanopsis nereis as new name. Thus, Melanopsis conspicua is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis nereis. Moreover, it is a junior secondary homonym of Lyrcaea conspicua Brusina, 1897.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 88) stated that Brusina (1897) had indicated one of the specimens illustrated by him (pl. 5, fig. 21) as type. However, it is uncertain whether the specimen actually derives from the original type series. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2992-638/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis constricta Brusina, 1878. Fischer (1996a) introduced Melanopsis handmanniana as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2848) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis vindobonensis Fuchs, 1870. Note that Wenz gave the name as “costata”, which is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis hazayi: Brusina (1903) indicated it as the typical form of the species. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prope Kanala [...]; insula Ouen” (Gassies 1870: 148) [near Canala; Île Ouen], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for the junior homonym Melanopsis fusiformis Gassies, 1870, non Sowerby, 1822, for which Gassies (1880) had already introduced Melanopsis rossiteri as replacement name. Thus, Melanopsis cookiana is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis rossiteri.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria, coll. no. 2011/0138/0100.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der Donau bei Pesth” [in the Danube river near Budapest], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on a manuscript or “in schedis” name from Küster in the museum of Von dem Busch (see Reeve 1860).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Römerbad in Steiermark” [Rimske Toplice], Slovenia (after Clessin 1890, no locality given in Reeve 1860).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on a manuscript name by Küster and introduced in synonymy of Melania hollandri [sic] Pfeiffer, 1828 (see also Brot 1874 and Clessin 1890). It was made available by Bourguignat (1884), who treated it as valid name (although he denoted the authority with “Bourguignat, 1877”; see Note 2). Junior homonym of Melania coronata Von dem Busch in Philippi, 1845 (Bengal).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntype (?) illustrated in Brusina (1897: 12, pl. 5, figs 15–16) is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2987-633 (Milan et al. 1974: 84).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In brooks and ‘gorgos’ from Anna, Valencia”, Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museo Malacologico di Cupra Marittima, Italy; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis coronata Brusina, 1878.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Mosculesti, dans la vallée de Gilortu, à Gura-Motrului et à Breasta, dans la vallée de Jiu” [at Musculești in the valley of the river Gilortu, at Gura Motrului and at Breasta in the valley of the river Jiu], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Galilee, southern Hula basin, about 500 m north of the new bridge over the river Jordan at Benot Ya’Aqov”, Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Paleontology Collection of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Pylle und Antimachia” (Neumayr 1880b: 295) [between Pýli and Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Invalid replacement name for Melanopsis broti Neumayr, 1880, “non Gassies, 1874”, but Gassies had actually introduced his species as “Melanopsis brotiana”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Cossmann, 1909, non Olivier, 1804. The name was corrected to “cossmanni” by Neubauer et al. (2014a: 461), which is a justified emendation according to Art. 32.5.1 and 33.2.2. Wenz (1929) considered all records of “Melania costata” from the Pliocene of Slavonia to represent the same species and synonymized them with Melanopsis abbreviata cosmanni. Obviously, he was unaware that Melanopsis croatica Brusina, 1884 is the first available name for them (see also discussion of Melanopsis pseudocostata Oppenheim, 1890).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Justified emendation of Melanopsis cosmanni Pallary, 1916 by Neubauer et al. (2014a: 461).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Eaux thermales d’Ouargla et près du chott Tiraoun dans le sud de la province de Constantine et de la Tunisie” [in thermal waters at Ouargla (Algeria) and near chott Tiraoun (Tunisia)], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De Orontes [Gesser-Chourl]” [in the Orontes river, at Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of the genus Melanopsis Férussac in Férussac & Férussac, 1807.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melania costata (Olivier, 1804). Speyer (1870: 97) introduced Melanopsis ludwigi as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: It is unclear from the original work in which of the studied localities/sections along the valleys of the Sutina, Batarelov and Vojskava rivers (4 km W of Sinj) the taxon occurred and in which not, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804). Neubauer et al. (2011) considered it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lanzaeana.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: It is unclear from the original work in which of the studied localities/sections along the valleys of the Sutina, Batarelov and Vojskava rivers (4 km W of Sinj) the taxon occurred and in which not, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804). Considered as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869 by Neubauer et al. (2011: 207).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “U Savi i u potoku kod Susjeda, u Žirovcu, u Maksimiru kod Zagreba, u potoku Toplici kod Oroslavja i u Kutinji blizu Jastrebarskoga” [in the river Sava and a creek at Podsused in Zagreb, in Žirovac, in Maksimir at Zagreb, in the river Toplica at Oroslavje and in Kutinja (?) near Jastrebarsko], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, based on an “in schedis” name from the collection of Kucik (also read as “Kutschig”). The name was probably a typesetting mistake for “costata”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans l’aqueduc de Séville [...] et dans les ruisseaux des environs. [...] Dans les lacs et les rivières du royaume de Maroc” [in the aqueduct of Sevilla and in the rivers of its surroundings (Spain); in the lakes and rivers of Morocco].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis cariosa (Linnaeus, 1767), which Férussac listed in synonymy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Du versant oriental du Kouh Mapeul” [eastern slope of mount Kuh-e Mapel, c. 60 km WNW of Khorramābād], Iran.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis costellata Férussac, 1823. Pallary (1916: 83) introduced Melanopsis douvillei as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aus einem Mühlbache bei Klinze ob Schischka” [from a mill creek at Glinica near Šiška], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 92).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brusina (1874) divided the species Melanopsis inconstans Neumayr, 1869 into three varieties, none of which he termed “inconstans”. The first one, “var. costulata”, he referred to as the typical one, which makes it an objective synonym of the nominal subspecies and hence Melanopsis inconstans.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 99) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2981-627/2.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis inconstans costulata Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1). Currently considered as a junior synonym of Melanopsis visianiana Brusina, 1874 (Neubauer et al. 2016b: 25).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis costulata Brusina, 1897.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis costulata Brusina, 1897. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis costulata Brusina, 1897. Has been considered to belong to the genus Coptostylus Sandberger, 1872 (Thiaridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “O. Taguenout” [Oued Taguenout, said to be near Beni Mellal], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis costulata Brusina, 1897.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis costulata Brusina, 1897.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les eaux chaudes du Djerid, au nord du chott Tiraoun, dans le sud de la Tunisie” [in the warm water of Djérid, north of chott Tiraoun], Tunisia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Lac Sabandja, près d’Ismidt, en Anatolie” [Lake Sapanca near İzmit], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der Muhr” (Pfeiffer 1828: 48) [in the river Mur], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brusina (1866) introduced the name for “var. A” in Pfeiffer (1828), which that author, however, had affiliated with the name “Melania agnata Ziegler” (see Pfeiffer 1828: 67). Therefore, Melania crassa Brusina, 1866 is a junior objective synonym of Melania agnata. Moreover, it is a junior homonym of Melania crassa Münster, 1841. Note that the latter species is certainly no Melanopsidae as it derives from the marine deposits of the Triassic St. Cassian Fm.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Save à Agram et rivière d’Ostaria en Croatie” [Sava river at Zagreb and Oštarije river], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der pliocänen Dreissensiaschicht von Dschisr esch-Schurr” [in the pliocene Dreissena layer at Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rio de Pedra Branca, procince de Bahia” [Pedra Branca river, province Bahia], Brazil.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of the genus Verena H. Adams & A. Adams, 1854 (Thiaridae) (see Nuttall 1990: 253).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 89) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen actually derives from the original type series and whether it was the only specimen Brusina had at hand. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2988-634.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Neumayr, 1969, non Olivier, 1804. Wenz (1929) considered all records of “Melania costata” from the Pliocene of Slavonia to represent the same species and synonymized them with Melanopsis abbreviata cosmanni. Obviously, he was unaware that Melanopsis croatica Brusina, 1884 is the first available name for them (see also discussion of Melanopsis pseudocostata Oppenheim, 1890).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2529-175/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 86).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis croatica Brusina, 1884. Wenz (1930) introduced Melanopsis haueri markusevecensis as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Morillo de Lena (Esera valley, Tremp-Graus basin), [...] CG-A2, sample 53”, Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museo di Storia Naturale, Università degli Studi di Firenze, coll. no. IGF 4334E.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis curta Gassies, 1870.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Plaine du Bahr-el-Houlé (haut Jourdain) dans l’Aïn-el-Mellaha” [in the plains of the Hula valley (upper Jordan), in Aïn Mallahah], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis curta Gassies, 1870. Heller et al. (2005: 248) considered the variety as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis curta Gassies, 1870. Wenz (1929: 2764) considered the variety as a junior synonym of Melanopsis kleini Kurr, 1856.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Station 119. Aïn Attig. Source près de la route de Rabat à Casablanca à 13 kilomètres de Rabat” [station 119 at Ain Attig. A spring near the road from Rabat to Casablanca, 13 km from Rabat], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: First of all, the name as given by Pérès (1939) is a nomen nudum – Pérès apparently considered the expression “curta” self-explanatory and did not describe it. Moreover, he obviously used the name not as separate taxon but rather as descriptive term to fit existing species into his morphological concept. He even indicated Melanopsis brevis Morelet, 1857 as its “type”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, “in schedis” name from Parreyss listed in the synonymy list of “Melania holandri” [sic] by Brot (1874).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 89) stated that only one of the specimens illustrated by Brusina (1902: pl. 29, figs 19–20) has been preserved, which they designated as lectotype. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2900-546/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Currently considered as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869 (Neubauer et al. 2016b: 24; see also Wenz 1929: 2698).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Im Rab zwischen Dschisr esch-Schurr und Kal ‘at el-Mdik; [...] in der pliocänen Dreissensiaschicht von Dschisr esch-Schurr auf dem rechten Orontesufer” [in the Al Ghāb between Jisr Ash-Shughur and Qal’at al Maḑīq; in the Pliocene Dreissena layer at Jisr Ash-Shughur at the right riverbank of the Orontes], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bei Zala Apati; [...] in der Umgegend des Plattensees, wie auf der Halbinsel Tihany” [near Zalaapáti; in the surroundings of Lake Balaton, as well as on the Tihany peninsula], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of Duabiana Starobogatov & Anistratenko in Anistratenko, 1993. Junior secondary homonym of Lyrcea cylindrica Stoliczka, 1862. Neubauer et al. (2014a: 456) introduced Melanopsis anistratenkoi as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Vallée de la Cettina” [Cetina river valley], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The taxon is not included in the Fossilium Catalogus of Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Oberes Niveau v. Zupića potok” (p. 47) [upper horizon of the Župića potok (near Sinj)], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 90) stated that Brusina (1897) had indicated one of the specimens illustrated by him (pl. 5, fig. 10) as type. However, it is uncertain whether the specimen actually derives from the original type series. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2984-630/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanoptychia dalmatina Bourguignat, 1880.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Danube à Ibraila; la Save à Agram; la Krapina à Sused (Croatie)” [Danube river at Brăila (Romania); Sava river at Zagreb; Krapina river at Podsused, in Zagreb (Croatia)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1880”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species epithet is a noun in apposition and needs not to agree in gender with the generic name (Art. 31.2.1). The name “daphne” as mentioned in Neumayr (1869: 369) and Hoernes (1876: 16) is an incorrect subsequent spelling. Wenz (1929: 2772) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis longa Deshayes in Férussac, 1839.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Auprès de Baden, en Autriche, dans un bassin d’eau thermale sulfureuse” [near Baden, Austria, in a sulphurous thermal water basin], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: There is considerable uncertainty about the correct authority and spelling of this species in the literature. It was first mentioned and validly described in the year 1821 as “Melanopsis Daudebartii” in an article in the Bulletin des Sciences, par la Société philomatique de Paris. Constant Prevost was often considered to be the author of this article, but from the title and text it is obvious that the article is an “Extrait” of a talk given by Prevost earlier and summarized by an anonymous author. According to Art. 50.2 and Recommendation 51D, the correct citation should be Melanopsis daudebartii [Prevost], 1821. The names “daudebarti”, “audebarti” or “audebardi”, each occurring multiple times in the literature, are incorrect subsequent spellings. Currently, the species is classified within the genus Microcolpia (see also Neubauer et al. 2014d: 126).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sidi Yahia, près d’Oudjda” [Sidi Yahya near Oujda], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis debilis Pallary, 1920.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Smendou, province de Constantine, Algérie” [Zighoud Youcef], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Fischer attributed the authority to Tournouër, but from the foregoing introduction it is clear that the species was described by Fischer.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bei Zala Apati am rechten Ufer der Zala und [...] im Gebiete des Plattensees” [near Zalaapáti at the right riverside of the Zala river and in the area around Lake Balaton], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally introduced as infrasubspecific taxon (“subvariety”) by Nevill (1884), but made available by Paetel (1888) who treated it as variety (Art. 45.5.1). Paetel clearly referred to the description of Nevill. Junior homonym of Melanopsis decollata Stoliczka, 1862.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Sabba Stefanescu, to whom Pallary referred, did not denote the localities of the figured specimens. He reported Melanopsis bouei from many localities in Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for a part of Stefanescu’s material of Melanopsis bouei (Stefanescu 1896: pl. 11, figs 63–64). Wenz (1929: 2681) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis decorata Pallary, 1916.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was also marked as new taxon by Brusina (1902: vii). It is uncertain whether Brusina really intended to introduce a new subspecies or actually referred to the species of Penecke (1884), which he had ranked as subspecies of Melanopsis croatica earlier (Brusina 1897).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Plattensée, en Hongrie [...]; à Stary Maydan Zakrzewski, dans le gouvernement de Podolie, non loin de Kamieniec-Podolsk” [Lake Balaton; at Staryy Zakrevskiy Maydan, not far from Kam’yanets’-Podil’s’kyi], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered as a junior synonym of “Hemisinus Esperi” Férussac (1823) by Brot (1878: 372).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Lake of Tiberias [Sea of Galilee] at the exit of the Jordan”, Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis boettgeri Brusina, 1902, non Klika, 1891. Jekelius (1944: 74) considered this species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis sturii Fuchs, 1873.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les canaux de l’Aguedal, à Marrakech” [in the channels of Aguedal in Marrakech], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “En Iraq; [...] à Rahalya Springs, à Kani Seip et à Karsi” [in Iraq, at Rahalya springs (?), at Kānī Seip (?) and at Karsī], Iraq.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary attributed the authority to Férussac based on a manuscript name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “D’Ambronay [Vallon de Jurancieu]” [from Ambronay, in the valley of Jurancieu], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’île de Wight” [Isle of Wight], United Kingdom.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on the record of “Melanopsis buccinoidea var. γ) antiqua; elongata” sensu Férussac, 1823 (pl. 7, fig. 6).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De la Moravie” (Férussac 1823: 164; no precise locality indicated), Czech Republic.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on a part of Férussac’s (1823: pl. 8, fig. 10) material of Melanopsis bouei. Homonym of the simultaneously published Melanopsis depressa Pallary, 1916, which has the higher rank in the species group and thus takes precedence (Art. 24.1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Harzhauser et al. (2015: 9) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis narzolina d’Archiac in Viquesnel, 1846.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “dertolina” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2802) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ruisseaux entre Tarsous et Mersina (Anatolie)” [streams between Tarsus and Mersin], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (1999: 56) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea (Olivier, 1801). In Heller et al. (2005: 248) in turn it is treated as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Nouvelle-Calédonie, dans l’intérieur” [inland of New Caledonia], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “U Savi kod Zagreba” [from the Sava river at Zagreb], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, based on an “in schedis” name in the collection of Kucik (also read as “Kutschig”). Brot (1874: 11) listed it in synonymy of Melania holandri [sic].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la source du jardin du Sultan, à Diabet, près Mogador” [in the springs in the garden of the Sultan at Douar Dyabat, near Essaouira], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Petit cours d’eau à Sadjour-Sou, entre Aïn-Taïb et Alep [...]; Aïn-el-Bass, dans la plaine du Bahr-el-Houlé (Syrie)” [small brook at Sadjour-Sou between Gaziantep (Turkey) and Aleppo (Syria) [...]; Aïn el Bass, in the plains of the Hula valley (Israel)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Babadjan, Sundi, Meissary und Chilaalidasch” [Babadzhan, Syundi, Meysary canyon, Mount Chila-alidasch], Azerbaijan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la Souani, à Tanger” [in Souani at Tanger], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Unclear: given as “Dans l’Oronte” [in the Orontes river] in text but as “Du lac de Homs” [Lake Homs (through which the Orontes flows)] in plate captions, Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “dircaena” as mentioned in Heller et al. (2005: 238) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Cossmann (1888: 279) and Wenz (1929: 2639) classified the species in the genus Faunus Montfort, 1810 (Pachychilidae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869 [June], non Melanopsis lirata Gassies, 1869 [January]. Both names are deemed to be identical after Art. 58.2.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Mare du moulin de la Cettina, près Almissa, en Dalmatie” [millpond at the river Cetina, near Omiš], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Letourneux, 1879”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Из Днепра у Херсона” [from the Dniepr river at Kherson], Ukraine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Riss/Würm end to early Würm Ice Age, Pleistocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Eger, az egri vár Zárkándy bástyájának átmetszése” [Eger, section at the Zarkandy bastion of the fortress Eger], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Magyar Állami Földtani Intézet (Hungarian Geological Museum), Budapest; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2016a) attributed the species to the genus Microcolpia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pantanelli 1886a: 69 or 1886b: 78, pl. 3, figs 5, 8 (precedence not established).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “S. Valentino, S. Agata, Boggione” [San Valentino, Sant’Agata Fossili, Boggione near Siena], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Harzhauser et al. (2015: 9) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis narzolina d’Archiac in Viquesnel, 1846.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. Graves attributed the authority to Defrance.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis nodosa Doncieux, 1908, non Férussac, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis brevis Doncieux, 1908, non Sowerby, 1826. For that homonym, Pallary (1916) had introduced the replacement name Melanopsis abbreviata, which is a junior homonym of Melanopsis abbreviata Brusina, 1874. (Note that Wenz 1919 was unaware of that name.) Melanopsis doncieuxi Wenz, 1919 is, however, invalid too it is a junior homonym of Melanopsis doncieuxi Pallary, 1916 (see Melanopsis atacica Wenz, 1928).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Issel 1865 [page unknown; original work not seen; described on p. 400 of the re-published version from 1866].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered a junior synonym of Melanopsis ammonis Tristram, 1865 by Heller et al. (2005). Considered a synonym of Melanopsis variabilis v.d. Busch in Philippi, 1847 by Martens (1874).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dorogh, Annathal, Nagy Kovacsi” [Dorog, Annavölgy, Nagykovácsi], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Island of Beilan-Beilan, to the north of the Obi Islands, Dutch East Indies” [Belangbelang Island], Indonesia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De Gafsa; [...] de Tozer et de Nefta” [from Gafsa; in Tozeur and Nafta], Tunisia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Given as “doutte” on p. 133, but as “douttei” in plate caption. Since Pallary explicitly named the species after E. Doutté, the name must read “douttei” (Art. 32.5.1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Du versant oriental du Kouh Mapeul” (Douvillé 1904: captions of pl. 46) [eastern slope of mount Kuh-e Mapel, c. 60 km WNW of Khorramābād], Iran.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis costellata Douvillé, 1904, non Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “draghiceniana” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2709) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Neualpe im Russbachthal” [Neualm near Russbach am Pass Gschütt], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Brignan, couches inférieures du Montaiguet et de Grabels; lignite de la Caunette” (it is unclear if this statement describes a single locality or several and, if so, from which the species derives), France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens, coll. no. 1963/84.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis dubiosa Matheron, 1878. Papp (1979: 668) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis longa Deshayes in Férussac, 1839.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Diahot, à Balade; à Jengen, à Kanala, dans les marais et les petits ruisseaux” (Gassies 1861: 289) [in the Diahot river at Balade; at Hienghène, at Canala, in swamps and small streams], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis carinata Gassies, 1861, non Sowerby, 1826.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des environs de Dax” [surroundings of Dax], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name first appeared in 1822 on the captions for plate 1 of the “Mélanopsides fossiles” in Férussac’s “Histoire naturelle” (see also introduction for details). While Férussac (1823) included also recent specimens under that name in his monograph on the Melanopsidae, the only specimen illustrated in 1822 in the “Histoire naturelle” was a fossil one from the Miocene of France. This fact remained widely unknown to biologists and paleontologists alike. Only few malacologists, such as Grateloup (1828, 1838, 1840), used the name correctly and attributed it to the French fossils. Consequently, none of the specimens referred to as Melanopsis dufourii in the biological literature actually corresponds to the real Melanopsis dufourii. Very likely, some of the other melanopsids from Dax (see, e.g., Grateloup 1838, d’Orbigny 1852, Pallary 1916) are unrecognized junior synonyms of this species.
The names “dufouri” as mentioned by numerous authors and databases and “dufourei” as given by Morelet (1853: 297) and Bourguignat (1884: 114) are incorrect subsequent spellings.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Les environs de Soissons” [surroundings of Soisson], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Cossmann (1888: 280) classified the species in the genus Faunus Montfort, 1810, Wenz (1929: 2623) affiliated it with Melanatria Bowdich, 1822 (both Pachychilidae). Note that both authors gave the name as “dufresnei”, which is an incorrect subsequent spelling. Moreover, Melanatria Bowdich, 1822 [February] is not an available name because it is a replacement name for the vernacular “Pyrene Lamarck” which was not available in nomenclature before April 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Re-described in French by Crosse (1869b: 281, pl. 8, fig. 4) [October].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Ippolito 1947: [p. 4 of the Separatum], [unnumbered plate], figs 32–35.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The taxon is not included in the Fossilium Catalogus of Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2637) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Faunus cerithiformis (Watelet, 1851) (Pachychilidae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Rhône Basin (no exact locality given), France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on material from the Rhône Basin, not Italy as claimed by Wenz (1929); probably the taxon was mixed up by Italian authors cited by Wenz (1929). Harzhauser et al. (2015: 9) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis narzolina d’Archiac in Viquesnel, 1846.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el Mâ et Fès” [Ras el Ma], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Jourdain; [...] dans le Belus près de Saint-Jean-d’Acre” [in the Jordan river; in the Na’aman river, near Acre], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 247) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis obliqua Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Nella Maremma Toscana in un fiumicello d’acqua calda detto Caldana di Ravi, presso Campiglia” [in the Tuscan Maremma, in a stream of warm water called Caldana di Ravi, at Campiglia Marittima], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not available from Rossmässler (1854), to whom Pallary referred, because Rossmässler did not use the term “elatior” to denote a species-group taxon but only cited Férussac’s (1823) description of an unnamed variety of Melanopsis dufourii. Pallary briefly described the taxon (by indicating its size) and therefore made the name available.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De la Save et de la Savina; [...] du Danube, près de Belgrade (Serbie), de Zenica (Bosnie), de la rivière d’Ostaria et d’un ruisseau sur là route de Pregrada, non loin de Krapina-Toeplitz, en Croatie; [...] au pont de la Save, près d’Agram” [in the Sava and Savinja rivers (Croatia, Slovenia); [...] Danube river near Belgrade (Serbia), Zenica (Bosnia and Herzegovina), in the river at Oštarije and a stream at the road to Pregrada, near Krapinske toplice (Croatia); [...] at the Sava bridge near Zagreb].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “Var. elegans” as mentioned by Rossmässler (1839) is a nomen nudum, referring to the personal opinion of Schmidt, with whom Rossmässler collected the material. If available, it would be a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis holandrii legitima Rossmässler, 1839, under which “elegans” was listed as a synonym by Rossmässler.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bizerè, nördlich von Pyrgos (Elis)” [Bizeré, north of Pyrgos], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Unclear: given as “L’Oronte à Djishr ech Chegour” [Orontes river at Jisr Ash-Shughur] in text but as “L’Oronte à Homs” [Orontes river at Homs (which is far to the south of the former)] in plate captions, Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Unavailable according to Art. 13.1, because it lacks a verbal description or definition. Heller et al. (2005: 244) considered it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-name: Melanopsis buccinoidea var. γ) antiquua elongata

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des environs d’Epernay. [...] De l’île de Wight” [surroundings of Épernay (France); Isle of Wight (United Kingdom)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced within the var. γ, to which Férussac attributed the term “antiquua”, which was probably not intended as species-group name (see introduction for a detailed discussion of the names introduced by Férussac 1823). Note that for figs 6 and 7 of pl. 7 in Férussac (1823), which is the same as pl. 1 of the “Mélanopsides fossiles” in Férussac (1819–1851), Pallary (1916) introduced two new names, i.e., Melanopsis depressa and Melanopsis sparnacensis.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Pallary (1916: 82) introduced Melanopsis goulvaini as replacement name for the junior homonym.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Tersannes près de Hauterives (Drôme)” [at Tersanne near Hauterives], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Wenz (1929: 2785) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis narzolina d’Archiac in Viquesnel, 1846.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Not included in the Fossilium Catalogus by Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Neubauer et al. (2014c: 29) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis citharella Merian, 1849.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Pallary (1916: 82) introduced Melanopsis sublongata [sic] as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Heller et al. (2005: 239) tentatively considered the variety as a junior synonym of Melanopsis khabourensis Pallary, 1939.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Collection stations 80 [tributary rivulet to the river Tensift] and 144 [Oued Sidi Raho, approximately 6 km upstream of its confluence with the Bou Regreg] (Pérès 1939: 139), Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: First of all, the name as given by Pérès (1939) is a nomen nudum – Pérès apparently considered the expression “elongata” self-explanatory and did not describe it. Moreover, he obviously used the name not as separate taxon but rather as descriptive term to fit existing species into his morphological concept. He even indicated Melanopsis olivieri Bourguignat, 1884 as its “type”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea elongata Férussac, 1822. Neubauer et al. (2014c: 31) considered this variety a junior synonym of Melanopsis defensa Fuchs, 1870.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Della valle della Sterza” (Capellini 1880: 420) [La Sterza near Lajatico], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania buccinoidea sensu Capellini, 1880, non Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, “in schedis” name from Tarnier listed in the synonymy list of Melania buccinoidea (Olivier, 1801) by Brot (1879).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Mélias, près de Figuig” [Ain Melias near Figuig], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously published name Melanopsis letourneuxi emaciata Pallary, 1928 (see Note 1). This case requires the action of a First Reviser.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously published name Melanopsis foleyi emaciata Pallary, 1928 (see Note 1). This case requires the action of a First Reviser.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“L’Oued Sous, au pont des Aït Melloul, sur la route d’Agadir à Tiznit, à 14 kil. S. O. d’Agadir” [in the Oued Sous, at the bridge of Ait Melloul, at the road from Agadir to Tiznit, 14 km southwest of Agadir], Morocco).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis letourneuxi emaciata Pallary, 1928 and Melanopsis foleyi emaciata Pallary, 1928 (simultaneously published; no priority fixed yet; see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Jéricho, dans ‘Ain Solthan” [at Jericho, in the spring ‘Ayn as Sulţān], Palestine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis letourneuxi emaciata Pallary, 1928 and Melanopsis foleyi emaciata Pallary, 1928 (simultaneously published; no priority fixed yet; see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Levit, près de Castellanne” [Vît-de-Castellane near Castellane], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 91).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2734) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis geniculata Brusina, 1874, while Neubauer et al. (2016b: 23) treated it as a distinct species. The name “enodota” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2734) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Perhaps a manuscript or “in schedis” name from Ziegler. Reeve (1860) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melania hollandrii [sic].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 90) defined a “lectosyntypus”, a term not accepted by the Code, based on the specimen from Tihany illustrated by Brusina (1902: pl. 6, figs 34–36). This fixation is insufficient for a valid lectotype designation (Art. 74). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2515-161/1-2.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bartha (1955: 294) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fuchsi Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Mont Bernon bei Epernay” (only this locality is the type locality as Pallary clearly referred to the specimen illustrated by Sandberger 1870–1875: pl. 9, fig. 5), France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania buccinoidea sensu Sandberger, 1870. Wenz (1929: 2660) considered that record a junior synonym of Melanopsis antidiluviana (Poiret, 1801). The name “eocaenica” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2662) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Près de Biskra, dans un ruisseau d’eau chaude à Ouargla, dans un puits artésien de Mazer au Ziban, ainsi qu’aux environs de Boghar et dans les rivières du djebel Takreda entre Mogador et Maroc [sic]” [near Biskra, in a stream of warm water at Ouargla, in an artesian well of Mazer, as well as around Boghar (Algeria) and in rivers of Jebel Takreda (?) between Essaouira and Morocco (?)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Wady Um Bagkek, between Sebbeh and Jebel Usdum, at the south-west corner of the Dead Sea”, Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 236) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis ammonis Tristram, 1865.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Bucovatz, dans la vallée de Jiu, et à Milcov, près de Slatina, dans la vallée de l’Oltu” [at Bucovăț, in the valley of the river Jiu, and at Milcov, near Slatina, in the valley of the river Olt], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “esperiodea” as mentioned in Huică (1977: 41) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Italien, Balearen [Westerlund]; aus Toscana als auch aus Jumilla (Spanien) und Merknes (Marocco) [Brot]” [Italy, Balearic Islands (Spain); Tuscany (Italy), Jumilla (prov. Murcia, Spain), Merknes (Morocco)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was first mentioned by Brot (1862: 63) as “etrusca Villa (v. min)” from the locality “Toscane”, without description or bibliographical reference. Brot listed it under the name “Melanopsis Dufourii Fér.”, for which a bibliographical reference (to “Rossm. Icon. 835–839”) and locality “Espagne” was given. Since etrusca was neither described by Brot nor by Rossmässler, the name etrusca is not available from this case (Art. 12.1).

Brot (1879: 434) listed the name (“Melanopsis etrusca Villa MSS.”) as synonym of Melanopsis Dufourii var. β, which he introduced there with a short Latin description. On p. 435 Brot even associated etrusca with an illustration of a specimen from Toscana (pl. 47, fig. 3). However, the name was explicitly referred to as synonym of the (unnamed) variety β, which is not a valid name, and thus the requirements of Art. 11.6 (and therefore 12.1) are not met (see Note 2).

Westerlund (1886: 128) used the name as “[Melanopsis lorcana] var. etrusca Villa ap. Brot (Cat. syst. Melan. 1862)” and provided a description and thus made it available as species-group taxon. Since he referred to Brot’s catalogue, the type locality comprises both his and Brot’s records. The authority of Melanopsis etrusca remains with Westerlund. Art. 11.6.1 does not apply here as Brot (1879) had listed the name as synonym of “Var. β”, which is not a valid name (see Note 2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2494-140/1-3 (Milan et al. 1974: 90).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered a junior synonym of Melanopsis pygmaea mucronata Handmann, 1887 by Papp (1953b: 150).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Jourdain, à 4 kilomètres au-dessus de la Mer Morte” [in the Jordan river, 4 km above the Dead Sea], Palestine/Jordan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Apparently by mistake, Heller et al. (2005: 245, 247) listed the species in synonymy of Melanopsis lampra Bourguignat, 1884 as well as of Melanopsis obliqua Bourguignat, 1884, both of which they ranked as subspecies of Melania costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aït Brahim; Tazouta; El Menzel; [...] l’Oued Raha, à Agouraï” [Aït Brahim, Tazouta, El Menzel, Oued Rha at Agourai], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivière d’Ostaria, entre Plaski et Ogulin, en Croatie; la Save, à Sissek, en Slavonie; la Narenta, en Dalmatie” [river at Oštarije, between Plaški and Ogulin; Sava river at Sisak in Slavonia; in the Narenta river in Dalmatia], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1880”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Agouraï, à 29 kil. sud de Fès” [Agourai, claimed to be 29 km south of Fès; judging from the map, Pallary obviously mixed up Fès with Meknès in this case], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: frequente nella zona centrale fossilifera” [Kos island: common in the central fossiliferous zone], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis magnifica expansa Pallary, 1920 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2720) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 90) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2966-612.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la rivière de la Krapina, à Sused, en Croatie” [in the river Krapina at Podsused, in Zagreb], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pantanelli 1886a: 64 or 1886b: 67, pl. 3, figs 12–13 (precedence not established).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for the record of Melanopsis acicularis sensu Capellini, 1873, non Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis fasciata Gassies, 1874. Pallary (1916: 86) introduced Melanopsis vittata as replacement name. The taxon was considered as a junior synonym of Melanopsis haueri by Wenz (1929: 2741).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “From a ‘qanat’ [= typical Iranian channel] at Jelalabad, near Kerman”, Iran.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis fasciata Gassies, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, “in schedis” name in collection of Kucik (also read as “Kutschig”), occasionally listed with authority “Stentz”. If available, the name would be junior homonym of Melania fasciata Sowerby, 1818 described from the Paleogene of the United Kingdom.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Taforalt. Aïn Sfa. Fès (Ras el Mâ). [...] Dar Batha, jardin public de bou Djeloud, séguias de dar el Maghzen, séguias en dehors de bab sidi bou Jida” [Taforhalt; Aïn Sfa; Fes; Ras el Ma; Dar Batha, park of Bou Jeloud, irrigation channels of Dar El Makhzen, irrigation channels outside Bab Sidi Boujida (all latter localities are within Fes)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot attributed the authority to Parreyss, based on an “in schedis” determination by that author. However, from the following text it becomes clear that Brot is the author of the species.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “NW slope of Fatelj hill near Kupres”, Bosnia and Herzegovina.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
