tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria, coll. no. 2011/0138/0107a.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for formerly misidentified Melanopsis mojsisovicsi Neumayr, 1880 in Neubauer et al. (2013: 137, figs 5E–F, I–K).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Jourdain, non loin de son embouchure dans la Mer Morte” [in the Jordan river, near its mouth at the Dead Sea], Palestine/Jordan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 232) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea (Olivier, 1801).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Mélias, près de Figuig” [Ain Melias near Figuig], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis excoriata festiva Pallary, 1920 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Westlich von Drvar” [west of Drvar], Bosnia and Herzegovina.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Monte Albuccio, [...] Valli della Pescaia, e del Riluogo [...] presso Siena; Castellacela presso Massa Marittima [...]; Colline di Piedimonte presso Terni nell’Umbria [...], tra S. Gemine e Carsoli sulla strada di Narni, e fra Otricoli e le Vigne sulla strada da Roma a Foligno?” [Monte Albuccio, Valli della Pescaia, Riluogo near Siena, Castellacela near Massa Marittima, Piedimonte hills near Terni in Umbria, between San Gemini and Carsoli on the road to Narni, and between Otricoli and Le Vigne], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2663) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis antiqua Férussac”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, “in schedis” name from Zelebor listed in synonymy of “Melania holandri” [sic] by Brot (1874). If available, it would be junior homonym of Melania flava Deshayes in Deshayes & Jullien, 1876 described from Cambodia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Mélias, près de Figuig” [Ain Melias near Figuig], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Wester-Buchberg, Loherflötz, Aubach, Rohmbach, Sulzgrabenflötz, Schlierachthal, Neumühle, bei Rimselrain, Pensberg, im Höllgraben, im Buchbergflötz, bei Schmerold, am hohen Peissenberge” [all localities near Miesbach, southern Bavaria], Germany.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Laboratoire de Géologie de la Faculté des Sciences de Toulouse; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally introduced as infrasubspecific taxon (“subvariety”) by Nevill (1884), but made available by Paetel (1888) who treated it as variety (Art. 45.5.1). Paetel clearly referred to the description of Nevill.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Cossmann (1909: 126) and Wenz (1929: 2873).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Oedinburg and Ruß” (Martini 1777: 204) [between Sopron (Hungary) and Rust (Austria)], Hungary/Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Papp (1953b: 133) designated the specimen illustrated by Martini (1777: pl. 94, figs 913) as lectotype (see also Art. 74.5). Since Gmelin explicitly referred to Martini’s work when describing the species, this designation is valid.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The taxon in question was first mentioned in the Catalogus by Walch (1768: 121, pl. C. II.*, figs 1–5), yet without name. Martini (1777: 203, pl. 94, figs 912–914) described and illustrated the species as “Pyrum fossile monstrosum f. amorphon” and referred to Walch’s work. Species-group names introduced in volumes 1–11 of Martini and Chemnitz’ Neues Systematischer Conchylien Cabinet (1769–1795) are, however, unavailable according to Opinion 184 (ICZN 1944). Gmelin (1791: 3485) referred to Martini’s work, described the species and was the first to assign an available name to the taxon: Buccinum fossile.

Férussac (1823), who was the first to combine the species with Melanopsis, listed the records by Walch, Martini and Gmelin but apparently did not consider “fossile” a valid name and introduced “Melanopsis martiniana” as new name. That name is permanently invalid as it is an objective synonym (see also Pallary 1916: 81).

The last summary of the status of Melanopsis fossilis was provided by Fischer (1996a), but his conclusions were unfortunately based on misinterpretations and nomenclatural errors. He was unaware of the fact that “Melanopsis martiniana” is an objective synonym of Melanopsis fossilis. Moreover, he considered the outcrops near Siegendorf as “locus typicus restrictus”, a term not existing in nomenclature.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ouggarta, à 60 kil. au sud de Beni Abbès, Sahara occidental” [Ougarta, prov. Béchar], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Tabebala, dans le Sahara occidental” [Tabebala (?), in the western Sahara], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, “in schedis” name in collection of Kucik (also read as “Kutschig”). If available, the name would be junior homonym of Melania fragilis Lamarck, 1804 from the Paleogene (Eocene?) of the Paris Basin.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria, coll. no. 1949/0004/0006.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 57) stated that Brusina (1897) had indicated one of the specimens illustrated by him (pl. 3, figs 27–28) as type. This can be accepted as valid lectotype designation in the sense of Art 74.5. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2964-610/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 91) defined a neotype based on the specimens illustrated by Brusina (1897: 8, pl. 6, figs 5–8) because the specimen from 1885 was apparently lost. The type fixation is insufficient with respect to Art. 75.3 of the Code. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2998-644.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “Fritzii” as mentioned in Chenu (1859: 297) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2813) synonymized the species with Melanopsis pygmaea Hörnes, 1856. Jekelius (1944: 75) invalidly synonymized it with Melanopsis handmanni, which is the objective junior synonym of Melanopsis fuchsi Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 91).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Fuchs, 1870, non Olivier, 1804. Junior homonym of Melanopsis fuchsi Handmann, 1882 (see Melanopsis confusa Strausz, 1941, Melanopsis handmanni Brusina, 1892 and Melanopsis hungarica Pallary, 1916, as well as Neubauer et al. 2014a: 461 for details).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Paludina (Vivipara) ornata Fuchs, 1877, non Vivipara ornata Neumayr, 1875, which was considered a Melanopsidae by Wenz (1928a).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des petits cours d’eau à Balade; [...] à l’île des Pins” [in small streams near Balade; L’Île des Pins], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: Born.” mentioned in De Cristofori & Jan (1832: Conchylia terrestria et fluviatilia, p. 7)

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, found only in the species list of De Cristofori and Jan (1832).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The taxon is not included in the Fossilium Catalogus of Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Isle of Wight; [...] New Charlton; [...] Woolwich; [...] New Cross near Deptford; [...] Hordwell”, United Kingdom.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on some of the illustrated syntypes of “Melanopsis antiqua Férussac, 1823” (actually, Grateloup referred to the illustrations of Melania buccinoidea in Férussac 1823; “Melanopsis antiqua Férussac” is not an available name). Junior homonym of Melanopsis fusiformis Sowerby, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prope Kanala; insula Ouen” [near Canala; Île Ouen], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis fusiformis Sowerby, 1822. Gassies (1880) introduced Melanopsis rossiteri as replacement name. Unaware of this, Pallary (1916) introduced Melanopsis cookiana as replacement name, which is its junior objective synonym.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis fusiformis Sowerby, 1822. Pallary (1916: 82) introduced Melanopsis angusta as replacement name. Wenz (1929: 2742) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis haueri Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: V. Tuvachiu, fra Antimachia e Pili” [Kos island: Tuvachia valley (?), between Antimácheia and Pýli], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis fusiformis Sowerby, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Priosa presso Narzole, Castelletto d’Orba, S. Marzano Oliveto”, Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: First mentioned in an unpublished thesis (Vergnau-Saubade 1966).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 57) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2963-609.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Brusina (1897: 6), Cossmann (1909: 126) and Wenz (1929: 2874). The names “caji” as mentioned in Cossmann (1909: 126) and “gayi” as given by Bandel (2000: 140) are incorrect subsequent spellings.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Affluents du lac Sabandja, près d’Ismidt” [tributaries to the Lake Sapanca near İzmit], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Locard (1883a).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Constantinople [...], a été trouvée dans la rivière d’Ismidt (Anatolie)” [Istanbul, found in a river at İzmit], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 68) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia coutagniana (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Les Martigues, les Pennes, Simiane, Gardanne, Fuveau, Peynier, Trets”, France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Munier-Chalmas (1884) indicated the authority with “Mun. Ch., 1870”, which is probably due to the fact that issues 1–3 of vol. 1 of Annales de Malacologie, in which the original publication appeared, were published in 1870 (issue 4, however, in 1884).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Weganrisse und Regenrisse 3 Km N Antirrion in Akarnanien” (Symeonidis et al. 1986: 342) [sections 3 km N of Antirrio, Aetolia-Acarnania], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Senckenberg Forschungsinstitut und Naturmuseum Frankfurt; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis posterior Schütt, 1986, non Papp, 1953.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 91) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3207-853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sources du Nahr es Sine, au Sud de Lattaquié, sur la route de Beyrouth” [Nahr as Sinn, south of Latakia, at the road to Beirut], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (1999: 61) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Palioskala Formation, middle Tortonian, late Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bachriß beim Höhenzug von Palioskala, ca. 700 m westlich vom Kap Phoka” [brook section near the mountain range of Palioskala, ca. 700 m west of Ágios Fokás, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Institute, University of Kiel, Germany; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dax. [...] d’Abesse et de Quillac à Saint-Paul” [Dax; Abesse and Quillac at Saint-Paul-lès-Dax], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2774) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis major Férussac, 1823”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivière près d’une villa sur la route de Pregrada, aux environs de Krapina, en Croatie” [river near a villa on the road to Pregrada, near Krapina], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales, Madrid, coll. no. M-327.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 89) stated that the single specimen of this taxon was lost.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 209 (Milošević 1962: 23).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis glabra Brusina, 1874. Neubauer et al. (2014a: 457) introduced Melanopsis vrcinensis as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was only mentioned in a species list by Bogachev without description or illustration. Moreover, he applied multiple original spellings: the name is given as “glabra” on p. 53, but “glarba” on p. 13, 33.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: It is unclear from the original work in which of the studied localities/sections along the valleys of the Sutina, Batarelov and Vojskava rivers (4 km W of Sinj) the taxon occurred and in which not, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanopsis glabra Brusina, 1874. Neubauer et al. (2011: 207) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ungarn ([...] ohne nähere Fundortangabe)” [Hungary, without indication of a locality], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii (Philippi, 1847).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Plate 26 of Sandberger’s monograph was issued in 1872, while the description on p. 520 appeared in 1875 (Woodward 1906).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Mélias, près de Figuig” [Ain Melias near Figuig], Algeria.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: Neubauer & Harzhauser in Neubauer et al., 2015

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Brickyard near the town of Martin, Turiec Basin”, Slovak Republic.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Múzeum Andreja Kmeťa in Martin, Slovak Republic, coll. no. SNM 16/2011 (PZ-703g).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia acicularis (Férussac, 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In schedis” name by Parreyss, introduced by Brot (1878) in synonymy of “Hemisinus acicularis (Férussac, 1823)”. Clessin (1890) made it available by treating it as a valid name (see Note 2). Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) again considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia acicularis.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: V. Bocasia, torrente Sefto, C. Foca, tra Antimachia e Pili” [Kos island: Vokasia valley, Sefto river, Ágios Fokás, between Antimácheia and Pýli], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les sources de Mézérib, au N. O. de Derâa (Syrie méridionale)” [in the sources of the Muzayrīb, northwest of Dar’ā], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prope vicum Antimaki [...] et prope civitatem Cos” [near near the village Antimácheia and near the city of Kos], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis elongata Gassies, 1874, non Férussac, 1822 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Tout près d’Oudjda, à 4 kilom. S.-E., sourdent les belles sources de Sidi-Yahia qui alimentent une véritable oasis, puis la ville d’Oudjda, et vont finalement se déverser dans l’oued Isly” [near Oujda, 4 km southeast, at the sources of Sidi Yahya that feed an oasis and the city of Oujda, and ultimately will flow into the Oued Isly], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2673) considered the variety as a junior synonym Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Les marnes à Potamides Basteroti de Visan (Vaucluse)” [in the marls with Potamides basteroti at Visan, Dép. Vaucluse], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis bouei gracilis Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1). Wenz (1929: 2793) considered the variety as a junior synonym Melanopsis neumayri Tournouër, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis bouei gracilis Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis bouei gracilis Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1). Wenz (1929: 2673) considered the variety as a junior synonym Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Моквинскіе пласты, разрѣзъ р. Дуабъ” [Mokvi layers at Duab river], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Herrmanns-Stollen im Lubellina-Graben, Gemeinde Ober-Skallis, nordöstlich von Schönstein” [Hermanns adit in the Lubellina ditch in Škale, northeast of Šoštanj], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: After Wenz (1929: 2505) this species belongs in the genus Pyrgulifera Meek, 1877 (Pleuroceridae), but Yen (1958: 194) doubted this classification.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis gradata Rolle, 1858. Wenz (1928b: 219) introduced Melanopsis tihanyensis as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis gradata Rolle, 1858.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Graells (1846) indicated that the “brothers Villa” dedicated the species to him. The name “graellsi” as mentioned in Pallary (1924: 250) is an incorrect subsequent spelling. It is unclear why Pallary considered the species as a junior synonym of “Buccinum annulatum Chemnitz”. That species, which is not available from Chemnitz (1795: 91, pl. 188, figs 1812–1813) according to Opinion 184 (ICZN 1944), is not even a freshwater snail but dwells in the southern Pacific (Nassariidae?).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“Dans le source de Yeni Chehir, [...] entre Antioche et Alep, à l’intersection de la route d’Alexandrette” [at the source of Yenişehir, between Antakya and Aleppo, at the intersection of the road from İskenderun], Turkey).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. Grateloup (1838: 139) listed the name (as “gratelupii”) in synonymy of Melanopsis aquensis Grateloup, 1838. Wenz (1929: 2774) synonymized the name (as “grateloupi”) with “Melanopsis major Férussac, 1823”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivières du bassin du lac Sabandja (Anatolie)” [rivers of the basin of Lake Sapanca], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1880”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 63) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] gallandi Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Entre St.-Germini et Carsoli” (Férussac 1823: 164) [between San Gemini and Carsoli], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for a part of the material of Melanopsis buccinoidea sensu Férussac, 1823 (pl. 8, fig. 3).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 91) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2500-146.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “guerneri” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2736) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De las cercanías del Cabo San Juan en la Guinea española” [in the vicinity of Cabo San Juan], Equatorial Guinea.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prope Cehejin Prov. Murcica” (Brot 1879: 438) [near Cehegín, prov. Murcia], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis obesa Brot, 1879, non Gassies, 1856.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bel Hadi-Kenadsa (Sud Oranais)” [Bel Hadi, near Kenadsa], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Danube près de Buda-Pesth, en Hongrie” [in the Danube river near Budapest], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat (1884) listed the name as “Hagenmulleria” on p. 51 but as “Hagenmülleriana” on p. 57. To my knowledge no later author has acted as First Reviser sensu Art. 24.2.3 and has mentioned both names and selected one as correct. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia cornea (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: From the writing in the original work it seems that Pavlović had apparently doubts about the validity of the taxon.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’Oued-el-Hammam [entre le Sig et Mascara]” [Oued el Hammam between Sig and Mascara], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2513-159/1-4 (Milan et al. 1974: 92).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as replacement name for the senior (!) homonym Melanopsis fuchsi Handmann, 1882, non Brusina, 1884. Wenz (1929: 2813–2814) synonymized Melanopsis handmanni as well as Melanopsis fuchsi Handmann, 1882 with Melanopsis pygmaea.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Fischer (1996a: 27) designated a lectotype (for Melanopsis constricta Handmann), which is stored in the collection of the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis martiniana constricta Handmann, 1887, non Brusina, 1878 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “A zsily-völgyi [...], továbbá Valia-Aninossaban és Paren lui Marin-ban, Lupény mellett. [...] gyakori Buda és Esztergom között [...], jelesen a Miklóshegyen, Annavölgyen, Mogyoróson és Pomázon” [in the Zsily valley; also in Valea Aninoasa and Paren lui Marin (?) near Lupeni (Romania); between Buda and Esztergom, at Miklóshegy, Annavölgy, Mogyorós and Pomáz (Hungary)], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: De Laubrière and Carez 1881: 403, pl. 16, figs 1–2.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Cossmann (1888: 279) and Wenz (1929: 2640) classified the species in the genus Faunus Montfort, 1810 (Pachychilidae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bei Sevilla im Guadalquivir” [near Sevilla, in the Guadalquivir river], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Čaplathal bei Podwin” [Čaplja graben near Slavonski Brod], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis subulata sensu Speyer, 1870, non Sowerby, 1822 and Melanopsis praerosa [= Melanopsis praemorsa] sensu Speyer, 1870, non Linnaeus, 1758.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Gropile Vulpilor près Titești” [Gropile Vulpilor (?) near Titești], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2570) classified the species within the genus Coptostylus Sandberger, 1872 (Thiaridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Currently attributed to the melanopsid genus Campylostylus (Bandel and Riedel 1994: 21).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn-Saadi, près de Kaifa, en Syrie” [Aïn Saadi, in Haifa], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2002: 601) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “U okolici Dubranca, [...] u Zagreb šumi, [...] kod Prvonožina” [near Dubranec, in the Zagreb woods, and at Prvonožina], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum (as “heerii”) in Sandberger (1873: 341).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Pylle und Antimachia; [...] beim Castell von Antimachia und in der näheren Umgebung des Dorfes Antimachia” [between Pýli and Antimácheia; near the citadel of and in the vicinity of the village Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Although described as Melania and not considered a Melanopsidae today, this species is included and briefly discussed here because it has been repeatedly considered a Melanopsis. The specimens had been apparently sent to Von dem Busch or Philippi by Meder, who had named the species “Melanopsis Helena”. The description, however, stems clearly from Von dem Busch. The species epithet is a noun in apposition and needs not to agree in gender with the generic name (Art. 31.2.1). Currently considered to belong in the marine genus Clea H. Adams & A. Adams, 1855 (Buccinidae) (e.g., Coelho et al. 2013).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans l’oasis d’Aïn-Chair, à l’extrême sud saharien du Maroc” [in the oasis of Ain Chair (= Oued Mellah), at the far southern Sahara in Morocco], Marocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1872”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Wenz (1929: 2874).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dschisr esch-Schurr, Dreissensiaschicht” [Jisr Ash-Shughur, Dreissena layer], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Tegelgrube der Fa. Wienerberger, Hennersdorf, NÖ” [claypit of the Wienerberger company at Hennersdorf, Lower Austria], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological Survey Austria, Vienna; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sources du Jourdain; [...] d’Aïn-el-Mellaha, dans la plaine du Bahr-el-Houlé; [...] lacs d’Homs et d’Antioche” [Sources of the Jordan; [...] Aïn Mallahah, in the plains of the Hula valley; [...] lakes Homs and Anuk (also as Amik)], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Kobelt, 1880, non Olivier, 1804. Bourguignat attributed the authority to Letourneux, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author. Heller et al. (2005: 243) listed the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804) as well as of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered a Melanopsis and a separate species by Quaggiotto and Mellini (2008: 44).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for the junior homonym Melanopsis turrita Handmann, 1887, non Rossmässler, 1854.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Plate 25 of Sandberger’s monograph was issued in 1872, while the description on p. 512 appeared in 1875 (Woodward 1906). Introduced for Melanopsis buccinoides [sic] sensu Grateloup, 1840, non Olivier, 1801, for which d’Orbigny (1852) had already introduced Melanopsis subbuccinoides as replacement name. Hence, Melanopsis hoernesi is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis subbuccinoides. Sandberger attributed the authority to Mayer, apparently based on an “in schedis” determination.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Fossil [..] bei Antakije. Lebend am unteren Orontes [...], desgleichen im Kara Su, einem nördlichen Zufluss des Sees von Antiochia und im Sadjür Su bei Aleppo” [as fossil near Antakya (Turkey). Alive in the lower Orontes (Turkey/Syria), as well as in the Karasu, a northern tributary of the Lake Anuk (Turkey), and in the Sājūr river near Aleppo (Syria)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis hoernesi Sandberger, 1872 (note that latter is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis subbuccinoides and thus invalid). Heller et al. (2005: 244) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bei Kroatisch Feistritz, am Fusse des Berges Terglou in Illyrien” [near Bohinjska Bistrica, at the foot of Mt. Triglav], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of Holandriana Bourguignat, 1884 and Amphimelania P. Fischer, 1885. The names “holandri” and “hollandri”, each occurring multiple time in the literature (e.g., Walderdorff 1864: 512; Brusina 1867: 85; Tschapeck 1881: 101), are incorrect subsequent spellings.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ad viam inter Sarajevo et Lukavica” [at the road between Sarajevo and Lukavica], Bosnia and Herzegovina.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 92) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2985-631.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Guadalquivir en Lora del Río, Sevilla” [in the Guadalquivir river at Lora del Río, prov. Sevilla], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii (Philippi, 1847).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis fuchsi Brusina, 1884 non Handmann, 1882, which itself was introduced for Melania costata sensu Fuchs, 1870, non Olivier, 1804. It is a junior homonym of Melanopsis hungarica Kormos, 1904 (see Melanopsis confusa Strausz, 1941).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The names “hibostoma” and “hypostoma” as mentioned in Pană (2003: 324) and Macarovici (1940: 344) are incorrect subsequent spellings.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Morocco, Mogador; [...] Spanien, Andalousien” [Morocco, Essaouira; Spain, Andalusia].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, listed in synonymy of “Melanopsis tingitana var. β” by Brot (1879), which is described briefly in Latin. He attributed the name to Morelet, but it remains unclear why - the only author mentioning a (nameless) variety of Melanopsis tingitana that matches the description by Brot is Mousson (1874).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species was also illustrated on pl. 2 of the “Mélanopsides fossiles” in the “Histoire naturelle” (Férussac 1819–1851) and on pl. 8 in Férussac (1823). However, Férussac obviously mixed up Melanopsis incerta with Melanopsis daudebartii and erroneously illustrated the latter of both species, which was already recognized by Deshayes when preparing the final explanations for the plates of the “Histoire naturelle”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis incerta Férussac, 1822. Pallary (1920b: 110) introduced Melanopsis revelata as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sources tièdes un peu avant Kerrando, au S.-E. de Rich (grand Atlas oriental, versant sud)” [hot Springs just before Kerrando, southeast of Rich (High Atlas range, southern side)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Illustrated syntypes are stored at the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna, coll. no. 1869/01/3/1-10.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Muchalatka” [not found; stated to be on the Crimean Peninsula], Ukraine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 93) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3020-666.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis inermis Handmann, 1882. Neubauer et al. (2014a) introduced Melanopsis magyari as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym and junior synonym of Melanopsis inermis Handmann, 1882 (see discussion in Neubauer et al. 2014a: 463).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Gurniati Formation, late Pliocene to early Pleistocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Küstenaufschluß ca. 4 km südwestl. von Kardhamena/Kos (Profil K 3)” [section K 3, ca. 4 km southwest of Kardámaina, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Institute, University of Kiel, Germany; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “inexpectata” as given by Kapan Yeşilyurt and Taner (2002: 107) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-name: Melanopsis buccinoidea var. γ) antiquua inflata

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des environs d’Epernay. [...] Du dépôt situé entre St.-Germini et Carsoli” [surroundings of Épernay (France); from deposits between San Gemini and Carsoli (Italy)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced within the var. γ, to which Férussac attributed the term “antiquua”, which was probably not intended as species-group name (see introduction for a detailed discussion of the names introduced by Férussac 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea inflata Férussac, 1822. Wenz (1929: 2813) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis pygmaea Hörnes, 1856.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea inflata Férussac, 1822. Neubauer et al. (2014c: 28) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fuchsi Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“Disjr ech Chogour” [Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Quellen des Chabur bei Ras-el-Ain” [source of Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Chekef, près Fès” [Aïn Chkef, near Fes], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bei Gross-Wardein in der schnellen Körös” [near Oradea in the Crișul Repede], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on a specimen of Melanopsis parreyssii figured in Kobelt (1880: 19, pl. 189, fig. 1909d). Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii (Philippi, 1847).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“L’Oued Sous, au pont des Aït Melloul, sur la route d’Agadir à Tiznit, à 14 kil. S. O. d’Agadir” [in the Oued Sous, at the bridge of Ait Melloul, at the road from Agadir to Tiznit, 14 km southwest of Agadir], Morocco).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis parreyssii innodata Westerlund, 1886 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“Djishr ech Chegour” [Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Martens (1874: 43, 67). Locard (1883a) introduced the species by referring to “Melanopsis Turcica de Mousson [...] 1874, p. 44” [act. p. 49], which he obviously considered different from the variety described in Mousson (1874: 33).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Oncophora Beds, middle Burdigalian, early Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Čtyroký (1972: 74) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis impressa Krauss, 1852.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis intermedia Rzehak, 1883.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis intermedia Rzehak, 1883.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Tappah, à 3 km Est de Belad Sindjar et ‘Ain Haglan” [Tappah, 3 km east of Sinjar and Ain Haglan (?)], Iraq.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis nodosa sensu Cerulli-Irelli, 1914, non Férussac, 1822. Girotti (1972: 232) considered Melanopsis nodosa sensu Cerulli-Irelli, 1914 a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis jordanica irregularis Mousson, 1861 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “ln a Za river affluent, between Guefait and Hassi Blal”, Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museo Malacologico di Cupra Marittima, Italy; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le lac d’Accesa, près de Massa, en Toscane (Italie); aux environs d’Oran; [...] dans la vallée du Nahr-el-Kelb, près de Beyrouth” [in the Lago dell’Accesa near Massa Marittima, in Tuscany (Italy); in the surroundings of Oran (Algeria); in the cave of Nahr el-Kalb near Beirut (Lebanon)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis maroccana sensu Bourguignat, 1864, non “Chemnitz” (which is not an available name; see there for details).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Plate 26 of Sandberger’s monograph appeared already in 1872, while the description on p. 666 (see also p. 687) was issued in 1875 (Woodward 1906). Harzhauser et al. (2015: 10) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis narzolina d’Archiac in Viquesnel, 1846.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bachbett der Küningsbeke an der Königsmühle bei Dingden” [Küningsbeke brook at the Königsmühle near Dingden], Germany.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zablachie bei Sebenico in Dalmatien” [Zablaće near Šibenik], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans quelques sources de la plaine de Jéricho (Syrie)” [in a few springs in the plains of Jericho], Palestine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Letourneux, 1882”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for the junior homonyms Melanopsis fuchsi Brusina, 1902, non Handmann, 1882 and Melanopsis hungarica Pallary, 1916, non Kormos, 1904, which were in turn introduced for Melania costata sensu Fuchs, 1870, non Olivier, 1804. However, already Strausz (1941) had introduced Melanopsis confusa as replacement name, which makes Melanopsis jekeliusi its junior objective synonym.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In flumine Jordano; in mari Galilaeo” [in Jordan river; in Sea of Galilee], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “judaica” as mentioned in Morelet (1880: 75) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Unjustified emendation and therefore junior objective synonym of Melanopsis jordanica Roth, 1839.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 92).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2678) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 226 (Milošević 1962: 23).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heidelberg Formation, late Santonian, late Cretaceous.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. Obviously a lapsus calami of Odostomia kaltenbachi Mertin, 1939.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Из Бабиног Дола близу Скопља” (p. 155) [Babin Dol near Skopje], Macedonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 1448 (Milošević 1962: 24).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geological Sciences of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, coll. no. 4602.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria, coll. no. 1869/0009/0013.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sources de Khabour, dites Ras el ‘Ain” [source of Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, apparently based on an unpublished manuscript name from Zelebor listed in the synonymy list of Melanopsis saulcyi by Brot (1879).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 93) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2970-616.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2013: 135) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2675) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Vallée de la Cettina” [Cetina river valley], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The taxon is not included in the Fossilium Catalogus of Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis praerosa [= Melanopsis praemorsa] sensu Dunker, 1848 and Klein, 1852, non Linnaeus, 1758. The name “kleini” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2762) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 93).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2741) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis haueri Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was only mentioned in a species list by Bogachev without description or illustration.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 93) indicated collection numbers for “syntypes” illustrated in Brusina (1902), but it is uncertain whether the specimens were part of the original type series. They are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2499-145/1-2.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Brusina (1884a: 138).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 58) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2481-127.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Gorjanović-Kramberger (1892: 109).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le canal de sortie des eaux thermales de Krapina-Toeplitz, en Croatie” [in the outlet channel of the thermal waters at Krapinske toplice], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Letourneux, 1879”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2535-181/1-4 (Milan et al. 1974: 93).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not indicated by Brusina (1905, 1907), apart from “probably Sinj Basin”, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Brusina (1905: 32).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les rivières des îles de l’Archipel” [it is unknown which Archipel Lamarck referred to].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species first appeared without name on a plate in the “Tableau encyclopédique et méthodique, vol. 3” by Lamarck (1797). The captions for most plates of the three volumes work were prepared by Bory de Saint-Vincent, but apparently not before 1824, and added to the “Tableau encyclopédique et méthodique, vol. 1” of Bruguière (1791; see note on pp. 83–84). In the captions, Bory de Saint-Vincent also referred to the “Histoire naturelle” (vol. 6, part 2) by Lamarck (1822), where the name first occurred.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Gradaschza und Ringelsza [bei Laibach]; aus einem Mühlbache bei Nassenfuss in Unterkrain” [in Gradaščica and Ringelsza (?) brooks near Ljubljana; from a mill creek near Mokronog] (the remaining localities mentioned cannot be assigned to the present variety without doubt), Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Rossmässler (1839) seems to have listed Melania holandri in synonymy of this variety, but from the text it is clear that the list is intended to refer to the species as a whole.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Wyczółki (wrzynka kol. trans. na zachodnio-południowym końcu wsi)” [Goncharivka, at southwestern end of village], Ukraine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis laevigata Lamarck, 1822. Wenz (1928a: 119) introduced Melanopsis lomnickii as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis laevigata Lamarck, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Eaux de Mathen, Alhama de Aragon” [waters of Mathen (?), Alhama de Aragón], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis laevigata Lamarck, 1822. The taxon appears at infrasubspecific rank in the plate captions of the original publication.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Neualpe im Russbachthal” [Neualm near Russbach am Pass Gschütt], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ruisseau de l’île d’Ivice, aux Baléares” [stream on the island of Ibiza], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis laevis Stoliczka, 1860.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Oued Masmouda; Ruisseau de Bab Hadid” [Oued Masmouda (?); stream Bab Hadid (?)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis laevis Stoliczka, 1860.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Mélias, près de Figuig” [Ain Melias near Figuig], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis laevis Stoliczka, 1860.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Köhler and Glaubrecht (2010: 873) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Madagasikara spinosa (Lamarck, 1822) (Pachychilidae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis lamarckii Potiez & Michaud, 1838. Cossmann (1888: 279) and Wenz (1929: 2640) classified the species in the genus Faunus Montfort, 1810 (Pachychilidae). The name “lamarcki” as mentioned in Wenz is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 463) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis mariei Crosse, 1869.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Belus, près de Saint-Jean-d’Acre, en Syrie” [in the Na’aman river, near Acre], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2002: 596) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804). Heller et al. (2005: 244) in turn treated it as an accepted name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Slobodnica; [...] Sibin [Sibinj]; [...] Malino; [...] Gromačnik; [...] Čapla [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; [...] Cigelnik”, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Из карагачких пескова” [from the sands of Karagača near Vrčin], Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 211 (Milošević 1962: 23).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 94) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2982-628.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “lanzae” as mentioned in Olujić (1999: 20, 49) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des environs de Nefta; [...] dans l’Oued Gabès et aux alentours de Tozer” [surroundings of Nefta; in the Oued Gabès and around Tozeur], Tunisia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Föllig d1 [...] und d2” [Föllig hill near Großhöflein], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria. The number Lueger provided is not the collection number but the acqusition number, which could be used to trace back the object in our database.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Taza, Ain en nsa, source est, chaude” [Taza, in the hot spring Ain en nsa], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der Laibach; in der Save” [Ljubljanica and Sava rivers] (the remaining localities mentioned cannot be assigned to the present variety without doubt), Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, apparently based on an unused manuscript name. It appears only in the synonymy list of Hemisinus [now Esperiana] acicularis in Brot (1870) with the authority “Schröter” as well in Brot (1874) with the authority “Parreyss”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2719) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Congeria rhomboidea Zone, Portaferrian, late Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 94) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3003-649.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivière entre Plaski et Ostaria, et dans la Save entre Agram et Sissek” [river between Plaški and Oštarije, and in the Sava river between Zagreb and Sisak], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] acroxia Bourguignat, 1884

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la rivière d’Ogulin, en Croatie; [...] dans la Migliaska, près de Sérajewo” [in the river at Ogulin (Croatia); in the Miljacka river near Sarajevo (Bosnia and Herzegovina)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Servain (1884: 379) [January]. Bourguignat (1884) [May] denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la source et la rivière de la Moulouiah, à l’ouest de Lalla-Maghnia” [in the source and the river Moulouya, west of Maghnia], Morocco or Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1872, et Letourneux”, apparently referring to Letourneux (1876b). That work is not available to me, but after Crosse (1877: 33) that record is a nomen nudum. It appears also as nomen nudum in Letourneux (1876a: 48). In addition, Bourguignat listed “Bourguignat. Spec. nov. Moll., no. 198, 1878”, which displays the second part of “Species novissimae Molluscorum” (Bourguignat 1876), but which was never published.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Save, au-dessous d’Agram” [Sava river below Zagreb], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rio de Pedra Branca, procince de Bahia” [Pedra Branca river, province Bahia], Brazil.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Although not explicitly stated, this variety was apparently considered to belong to the new genus Verena by Adams and Adams (1854) (Thiaridae), of which Melanopsis crenocarinata is the type species (see Nuttall 1990: 253).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Corgnale, Divacca und unteres Gaberg-Gehänge” [Lokev, Divača, and lower slopes of Mt. Vremščica], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Stache (1880: 199).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Oppenheim (1892: 757) and Bandel and Riedel (1994: 20) considered the species as a junior synonym of Esperiana obeloides (Tausch, 1886).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis scalaris Handmann, 1882, non Gassies, 1856. Wenz (1929: 2741) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis haueri Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary erroneously gave the name as “unicincta” in the plate captions. Heller and Sivan (2002a: 49) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis multiformis Blanckenhorn, 1897.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of the genus Pseudofagotia Anistratenko, 1993.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La rivière Balade” [in the river Balade], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Gassies (1861) apparently considered Melania lineolata Gray in Griffith & Pidgeon, 1833 as a Melanopsis, which resulted in secondary homonymy for his species Melanopsis lineoloata Gassies, 1857. Thus, he introduced Melanopsis livida as a replacement name. Secondary homonymy, however, is not given anymore, since Melania lineolata Gray was recently shown to belong to the genus Cerithidea Swainson, 1840 (Potamididae) by Reid (2014). (Note, moreover, that Melania lineolata Gray is a junior homonym of Melania lineolata Wood, 1828). Melanopsis livida is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis lineolata Gassies (see also Art. 59.3). Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Diahot à Balade” [in the Diahot river at Balade], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for the presumed secondary homonym Melanopsis lineolata Gassies, 1856, non Melania lineolata Gray in Griffith & Pidgeon, 1833. Secondary homonymy, however, is not given anymore, since Melania lineolata Gray was recently shown to belong to the genus Cerithidea Swainson, 1840 (Potamididae) by Reid (2014) (see also Art. 59.3). (Note, moreover, that Melania lineolata Gray is a junior homonym of Melania lineolata Wood, 1828). Melanopsis livida is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis lineolata Gassies. Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Lebend im See von Antiochia. Halbfossil bei Selemije” [living in Lake Anuk (also as Amik) (Turkey); subfossil near As Salamīyah (Syria)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le lac Sabandja, près d’Ismidt (Anatolie)” [Lake Sapanca near İzmit], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1882”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Wyczółki (wrzynka kol. trans. na zachodnio-południowym końcu wsi)” (Łomnicki 1886: 76) [Goncharivka, at southwestern end of village], Ukraine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis laevigata Łomnicki, 1886, non Lamarck, 1792.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Férussac 1819–1851: Mélanopsides fossiles, pl. 2, fig. 8 (altered caption by Deshayes delivered with Livraison 29; see introduction for details).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Gozhik and Datsenko 2007: 95, pl. 95, figs 1–5, pl. 97, fig. 3.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aллювия V террасы р. Дунай у с. Нагорное” [Alluvial terrace V of the Danube river near Nagornoye], Ukraine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geological Sciences of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, coll. no. 6461.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“longus”), but Microcolpia is feminine, which is why the name must be “longa”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on the record of “Melanopsis sp.” in Andrusov (1909: 88, pl. 5, figs 1–2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les séguias de Beni Abbès” [in the irrigation channel of Beni Abbès], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis longirostris Pallary, 1920.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2733) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fusulatina Sacco, 1895.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In rivulo Rambla de Viznaga et in Pantano de Puentes non procul Lorca in Regno Murcico” [in the river Rambla de Viznaga and in Pantano de Puentes, not far from Lurca, prov. Murcia], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appears as “Lorteti” in Locard’s remarks on p. 272, which is apparently based on a typesetting error.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 94) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3639-1279/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria, coll. no. 2010/0042/0001.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: This taxon was considered to belong to the marine genus Nozeba Iredale, 1915 (Iravadiidae) by Ponder (1984: 56).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. Erber attributed the authority to Mousson. Given as “Luciae” in Paetel (1888).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melania costata Ludwig, 1865, non Olivier, 1804.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Entre Koulana et Lus-han” [between Koulana and Lus-han, S of Drin river mouth], Albania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the name was introduced as “Lus-Hani”; the name “Lushami” as mentioned in Chenu (1859: 297) is an incorrect subsequent spelling. Wenz (1929: 2715) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 248) considered the variety as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Sandberger (1871: 88) attributed the species to the genus Paludomus Swainson, 1840 (Paludomidae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Illustrated syntype is stored at the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna, coll. no. 1869/01/6.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Unlike stated by Neubauer et al. (2016b: 25), the name Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869 [June] is deemed to be a junior homonym of Melanopsis lirata Gassies, 1869 [January] after Art. 58.2. Pallary (1916: 85) introduced Melanopsis dissimilis as replacement name. Wenz (1929: 2698) was aware of the homonymy issue and synonymized this species with Melanopsis cylindracea Brusina, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La rivière entre Plaski et Ostaria (Croatie)” [river between Plaški and Oštarije], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ueskueb” [Skopje], Macedonia (not Zvezdan in Serbia as given by Wenz 1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Beni Mellal, dans l’oued Taguenout” [Beni Mellal, in the Oued Taguenout (?)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der Muhr” [in the river Mur], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, apparently based on an unused manuscript name from Parreyss listed in synonymy of “Melania Holandri” [sic] by Brot (1874).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior synonym of Hemisinus osculati (Villa in Villa & Villa, 1854) (Thiaridae) after Ramírez et al. (2003: 272).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary (1916) erroneously treated “magna” as available name attributed to Férussac (1823), who solely used the word as descriptive term (Latin “big”), which he applied to many of his varieties. The name became nevertheless available from Pallary (1916) who associated the name with an illustration in Férussac (1823: pl. 7, fig. 16). The illustrated specimen is, however, the holotype (by monotypy) of Melanopsis dufourii Férussac, 1822 (Férussac used the same plates in both of his works and thus Pallary actually referred to the specimen illustrated as Melanopsis dufourii in the “Histoire naturelle”; see also introduction and Table 1 for details of Férussac’s publications). Therefore, Melanopsis magna Pallary, 1916 is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis dufourii.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis magna Pallary, 1916.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geology and Geophysics, University of Bucharest, coll. no. 14655.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“magnus”), but Melanopsis is feminine, which is why the name must be “magna”. Junior homonym of Melanopsis magna Pallary, 1916.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 93) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand when describing Melanopsis klerici inermis (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3020-666.

tp:treatment-sec.p: “De Mandillot, près de Dax” [Mandillot, near Dax], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: This name has appeared several times in the literature (e.g., Bronn 1848: 717; Wenz 1929: 2773), but it is based on an error. Férussac (1823: 154) actually described Melanopsis dufourii var. ε and listed “Fossilis, major. Férussac” in synonymy referring to plate 1 of the “Mélanopsides fossiles” of his “Histoire naturelle” (Férussac 1819–1851; see also introduction for details about this work). However, in the captions of plate 1, it is given as “Melanopsis Dufourii, var. ε). Fossilis, maxima”. Obviously neither major nor maxima was intended as species-group name by Férussac. Later, the name would have been a junior homonym of Melania buccinoidea major Grateloup, 1838.

tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as “mut. nov.” which is not ruled by the provisions of the Code.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De Binisalem et de Selva” [from Binissalem and Selva, Mallorca], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, listed by Hermite in a section called “Espèces nouvelles citées et non décrites” [= “new species identified and not described”], where he listed 18 new names that he intended to describe in the second volume of his “Études géologiques sur les îles Baléares”. That part, however, has never been published, probably because Hermite died in 1880.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Ludian?–Sannoisian, Priabonian–early Rupelian, late Eocene–early Oligocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Au Mas-Saintes-Puelles (Aude); [...] de la Massale, près de Castres; [...] à Labruguière; [...] à Saint-Genest-de-Contest, à Lautrec (Tarn)” [at Mas-Saintes-Puelles (Dép. Aude); from Massale near Castres; at Labruguière; at Saint-Genest-de-Contest, at Lautrec (Dép. Tarn)], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “masensis” as mentioned in Dollfus (1906: 292) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la daya de Habessa, ancien lac desséché, situé à plus de 200 lieues environ au sud d’Oran” [in the Daïa Habessa, an old, desiccated lake, located more than 800 km south of Oran], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales, Madrid, coll. no. M-435.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Mainzer Becken” [Mainz Basin, no locality indicated], Germany.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2726) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fritzei Thomä, 1845.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In loco ‘Baie du Sud’” [Baie Sud], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Re-described in French by Crosse (1869b: 280, pl. 8, fig. 5) [October].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis austriaca croatica Brusina, 1902, non Brusina, 1884 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prov. Oranensem” [province of Oran; no locality indicated], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was first mentioned by Chemnitz (1795) as “Buccina Maroccana”. However, according to Opinion 184 (ICZN 1944), species names introduced in volumes 1–11 of Martini and Chemnitz’ “Neues Systematischer Conchylien Cabinet” (1769–1795) have no status in nomenclature and the name is therefore not available from this work. The name was again listed by Férussac (1823) in synonymy of two different species, i.e., Melanopsis dufourii Férussac, 1822 (referring to Chemnitz 1795: pl. 210, figs 2078–2081) and Melanopsis costellata (referring to Chemnitz 1795: pl. 210, figs 2082–2083). A mention in synonymy, however, does not make the name available (see Note 2).

The first to adopt Melanopsis maroccana as a valid name was Morelet (1853). (Note that in the same year Bourguignat mentioned the name in his “Catalogue raisonné des mollusques terrestres et fluviatiles [...]”, which, according to the preface was published not before 1 December 1853, while Morelet’s paper was issued on 1 August 1853.) Morelet (as well as Bourguignat) referred to Chemnitz’ work – but only to figs 2080–2081 – and listed Melanopsis dufourei [sic] as a synonym. Morelet did not provide a description or illustrations on his own; the brief Latin description he gave below the synonymy list refers to the unnamed variety β. The reference to the illustrations in Chemnitz nonetheless suffices as indication of a new taxon; the correct name is therefore Melanopsis maroccana Morelet, 1853. Although Morelet (1853) considered the older Melanopsis dufourii as a junior synonym of Melanopsis maroccana, the two names are no objective synonyms because Morelet referred to more specimens than just the holotype of Melanopsis dufourii (fig. 16). Note, moreover, that Morelet’s synonymization is likely based on a wrong concept of Melanopsis dufourii, which is a fossil species described from the Miocene of France.
The name “marocana” as mentioned in Pallary (1920c: 145) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Près de Taforalt; Oued Cherâa à Berkane” [near Taforhalt; Oued Cherraa at Berkane], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Férussac 1819–1851: Mélanopsides fossiles, pl. 2 (1823), figs 11–13 or Férussac 1823: 155, pl. 8, figs 11–13 (precedence not established; see introduction for discussion).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les environs de Bisentz et de Scharditz, en Moravie, dans la vallée de la Marsch, affluent du Danube” [in the surrondings of Bzenec and Šardice in Moravia, in the valley of the March river, a tributary of the Danube], Czech Republic.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (for details see there). The name “martinii” as mentioned by numerous authors (e.g., Chenu 1859: 297) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Narzole?” (p. 189; apparently the locality was uncertain), Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2783) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis narzolina d’Archiac in Viquesnel, 1846.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Berguent, le Ras al Aïqun des Beni-Mattar” [Ras el Aïn at Aïn Beni Mathar], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis letourneuxi sensu Pallary, 1899 (pl. 8, fig. 6), non Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Unjustified emendation and therefore junior objective synonym of Melanopsis mauritanica Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Çà et là de Maroc” [here and there in Morocco; no locality indicated].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bir Jaloûd” [not found, in the Middle East].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sakarya başi, main spring of Sakarya river near village Çifteler, 60 km SE Eskişehir, 160 km WSW of Ankara”, Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Senckenberg Forschungsinstitut und Naturmuseum Frankfurt, coll. no. SMF 232011.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les eaux le l’ancien Léonthes” (Mousson 1854: 51) [in the Litani river], Lebanon.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis brevis Parreyss in Mousson, 1854, non Sowerby, 1826 (see also Pallary 1916). Blanckenhorn (1897) denoted the authority as “Bourg.”, but from the discussion it is clear that Blanckenhorn must be the author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis maroccana media Blanckenhorn, 1897 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De la petite rivière de Guadaira qui se jette dans le Guadalquivir” [in the little river Guadaira which flows into the Guadalquivir], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis maroccana media Blanckenhorn, 1897 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for the junior secondary homonym Melanoptychia bittneri Neumayr, 1880, non Melanopsis bittneri Fuchs, 1877. Neubauer et al. (2016c: 275–276) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis carusi (Brusina, 1902).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“megacanthus”), but Melanopsis is feminine, which is why the name must be corrected to “megacantha”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. If available, it would be a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis sikorai: Brusina (1903) indicated it as the typical form of the species. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “En Haruv [...], a small spring on the Golan Heights that pours into a small cement pool” [near Kefar Haruv], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: National mollusc collection of the Hebrew University, Jerusalem, coll. no. HUJ 7966.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rio de Pedra Branca, procince de Bahia” [Pedra Branca river, province Bahia], Brazil.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Although not explicitly stated, this variety was apparently considered to belong to the new genus Verena by Adams and Adams (1854) (Thiaridae), of which Melanopsis crenocarinata is the type species (see Nuttall 1990: 253).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’Oued Taguenout à Beni Mellal” [Beni Mellal, in the Oued Taguenout (?)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “‘Ain Arouss (la source de la fiancée), près de Tell Abiad, d’où naît le Nahr Bâhlik, qui se jette dans Euphrate, un peu au-dessous de Rakka, la métropole de Haroun el Rachid” [‘Ayn al ‘Arūs (source of the bride), near Tall Abyaḑ, from which arises the Nahr al Balīkh, which flows into the Euphrates, a little below Ar Raqqah, the metropolis of Harun al-Rashid], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 254) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis infracincta Martens, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 1196 (Milošević 1962: 24).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
