tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À St. Agata près de Tortone” (Michelotti 1847: 191; the other localities Michelotti apparently adopted from other works) [at Sant’Agata Fossili near Tortona], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis carinata sensu Michelotti, 1847, non Sowerby, 1826. Wenz (1929: 2671) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bonellii Manzoni, 1870.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Près de Jéricho, dans la fontaine de Jérémie (Palestine)” [near Jericho, in the spring of Jeremiah (?)], Palestine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ruisseau de la source de la Moulouiah, près de Lalla-Maghnia sur la frontière marocaine (prov. d’Oran)” [in the source of the river Moulouya, near Maghnia at the border to Morocco], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. If available, it would be a junior homonym of Melanopsis microstoma Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De l’intérieur de la Mingrélie [...], puis de Réduktaleh” [from the interior of Samegrelo; from Q’ulevi (also read as Kulevi, former Redut-Kale)], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Mousson attributed the authority to Bayer, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author. Bayer only seems to have collected a part of the material.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der tiefsten Thonbank des linken Orontesufers bei Dschisr esch-Schurr” [in the lowest clay bank at the left riverside of the Orontes near Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as “n. mut.” but clearly as a binomen and hence not infrasubspecific in the sense of ICZN Art. 45.6.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In schwach schwefeligen Quellen [...] bei Vöslau unweit Baden” [in weakly sulfurous springs stones and sands at Vöslau near Baden], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis daudebartii [Prevost], 1821, which Rossmässler listed in synonymy. Moreover, the name is a junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Quellen des Chabur bei Ras-el-Ain” [source of Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Tersannes près de Hauterives (Drôme)” [at Tersanne near Hauterives], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1). Wenz (1929: 2669) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bonellii Manzoni, 1870.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ruisseau d’eau chaude à Ouargla (prov. de Constantine) et eaux thermales du Djérid, au nord du chott Tiraoun (sud de la Tunisie)” [in warm waters at Ouargla (Algeria) and thermal water of Djérid, north of chott Tiraoun (Tunisia)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1). Blanckenhorn (1897) indicated himself as author of the taxon, but he clearly cited the record by Bourguignat (1884) in the synonymy list. Wenz (1929) introduced Melanopsis blanckenhorni as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Environs d’Alep, à Sadjour-Sou, à quatre kilom. en aval d’Aïn-Taïb; ruisseaux à Doumar, sur l’oued Baradah, près Aïn-Fidji, et à Banias, en Syrie” [Surroundings of Aleppo (Syria), at Sadjour-Sou, 4 km downstream of Gaziantep (Turkey); streams at Dummar, at the river Barada, near Aïn al-Fiji and at Bāniyās (Syria)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not indicated, but probably as for the species (“Dans la Save, au-dessous d’Agram” [in the Sava river below Zagreb], Croatia).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia cornea (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melania tuberculata minor Brot, 1877 from Sri Lanka (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Tout près d’Oudjda, à 4 kilom. S.-E., sourdent les belles sources de Sidi-Yahia qui alimentent une véritable oasis, puis la ville d’Oudjda, et vont finalement se déverser dans l’oued Isly” [near Oujda, 4 km southeast, at the sources of Sidi Yahya that feed an oasis and the city of Oujda, and ultimately will flow into the Oued Isly], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Berguent, le Ras al Aïqun des Beni-Mattar” [Ras el Aïn at Aïn Beni Mathar], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des bords du Chott Djerid, à Tozeur” [banks of the Chott el Djérid at Tozeur], Tunisia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not indicated, but probably as for the variety (“La Makina”, Morocco).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as infrasubspecific taxon, which is not ruled by the provisions of the Code.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Fès: source près de la ferme proche du pont neuf, à dar Mahrès; Sidi Harazen (source chaude); Moulai Idriss du Zehroun, source sulfureuse chaude; El Menzel; Tazouta” [Fes: source near the farm at the new bridge, at Dar Mahres; Sidi Harazem (hot spring); Moulay Driss Zerhoun, hot sulfur springs; El Menzel; Tazouta], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Fortuna et Caravala [Caravaca?] (Murcia). Lorca, Valencia et Alicante”, Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bel Hadi-Kenadsa (Sud Oranais)” [Bel Hadi, near Kenadsa], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “O. Taguenout” [Oued Taguenout (?), said to be near Beni Mellal], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“La Zousfana, à la hauteur de Figuig et à Beni Ounif” [Oued Zousfana, at the height of Figuig, and at Beni Ounif], Algeria).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Name appears only in the plate captions. Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not stated but probably the same or partly as for the species (“Berguent; Aoûllout; Ras el Mâ de Fès; O. Chkef près Fès” [Aïn Beni Mathar, Aïn Aoullout, Ras El Ma, Oued Aïn Chkef in Fes], Morocco).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans l’eau tiède du bassin de Diane, à Smyrne” [in warm water basin of Halkapınar at Izmir], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le canal de la Butte de tir, à 7 km Sud de Baghdad” [in a trench of a firing hill (?), 7 km south of Baghdad], Iraq.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Ranked as a variety of Melanopsis nodosa Férussac in the plate captions. Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les sources de Mézérib, au N. O. de Derâa (Syrie méridionale)” [in the sources of the Muzayrīb, northwest of Dar’ā], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea minor Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Paleontology, University of Vienna; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“L’Oued Sous, au pont des Aït Melloul, sur la route d’Agadir à Tiznit, à 14 kil. S. O. d’Agadir” [in the Oued Sous, at the bridge of Ait Melloul, at the road from Agadir to Tiznit, 14 km southwest of Agadir], Morocco).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Viannos Formation, early Tortonian, late Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Tongrube 1 km westlich von Limin Chersonisou/Kreta” [claypit 1 km west of Chersonisos, near Agia Anna chapel], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Used as valid name by Wenz (1929: 2780), but obviously not intended as species-group name by Férussac (1823: 150, pl. 7, fig. 4). The name became nevertheless available from Pallary (1916) who treated it as valid species-group name and associated it with an illustration in Férussac (1823: pl. 7, fig. 4). See introduction for a detailed discussion about the names used by Férussac (1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Fontaine froide du Hammam à Brousse (Anatolie); Nahr-Antalies dans le Liban (Syrie); puits artésien de Tamerna-Kedima, dans le Ziban (Algérie)” [cold springs in a Hamam at Bursa (Turkey); Nahr-Antalies (?) in the Lebanon; artesian well of Tamerna Kedima (Algeria)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 94) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2972-618.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2011: 207) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Nord-Nordwestlich von der Solfatare bei Susaki” [north-northwest of Solfatara Sousáki], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: First mentioned as nomen nudum in Papp and Thenius (1952: 4). Junior synonym of Amphimelania gayi [sic] after Bandel (2000: 140).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens, coll. no. 1963/83.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The status of this species is unclear. First of all, Kühn did not at all refer to the senior homonym Melanopsis (Melanosteira) mitzopoulosi Papp, 1955 but clearly described the species as new. Neither did Papp (1979: 668), who must have been aware of the issue and who ranked it as a subspecies of Melanopsis longa Deshayes in Férussac, 1839. Moreover, Papp stated that Kühn’s species was based on the material collected by Papp (1947) and considered the type locality mentioned by Kühn a mistake. Kühn (1963), however, did not refer to Papp’s material at all.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“Au cours de l’Euphrate et du Tigre” [from the Euphrates and Tigris rivers], Iraq).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1874–1879: 432) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis nodosa Férussac, 1822, which is actually a fossil species described from the Miocene of France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was only mentioned in a species list by Bogachev without description or illustration. If available, it would be a junior homonym of Melanopsis nodosa moderata Mousson, 1874 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was only mentioned in a species list by Bogachev without description or illustration.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Foum el Ançeur et Tirboula, près de Ksiba (Moyen Atlas méridional)” [Foum El Anceur and Tirboula, near Ksiba (southern Middle Atlas)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanopsis moesiensis Jekelius, 1944 (same work). Neubauer et al. (2014a: 463) considered both synonymous and gave priority to Melanopsis moesiensis (since Melanoptychia is considered a synonym of Melanopsis).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les sources et la rivière du jardin du Sultan, à Mogador” [in the sources and the river of the garden of the Sultan, at Essaouira], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis praerosa [= Melanopsis praemorsa] sensu Morelet, 1880, non Linnaeus, 1758. Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1881”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The type material, with all specimens studied by Neumayr (1880), is lost. Neubauer et al. (2016c: 278) defined a neotype based on material from the type locality. The specimen is stored in the Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, coll. no. 2014/0364/0013.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Lignitos de Selva y Binisalém” [lignites of Selva and Binissalem], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2675) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality
tp:treatment-sec.p: (Type locality of Melanopsis biliottii). “Rhodos” (locality specified as “Monolithos” in Bukowski 1893), Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Dollfus mentioned the name as nomen nudum without explanation alongside the discussion of [Melania costata] “Var. Biliottii Buk.”. Apparently, he considered it a potential new name should biliottii be elevated to the species level. If not already a nomen nudum, Melanopsis monolithos would therefore be a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis biliottii Bukowski, 1892, which actually was introduced as a distinct species (see also Willmann 1981: 105).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’Oued Sous, au pont des Aït Melloul, sur la route d’Agadir à Tiznit, à 14 kil. S. O. d’Agadir” [in the Oued Sous, at the bridge of Ait Melloul, at the road from Agadir to Tiznit, 14 km southwest of Agadir], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In den Bächen Krains” [in rivers of Carniola, a historical region that comprised parts of present-day Slovenia].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis brevis Morelet, 1857, non Sowerby, 1826.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis subcarinata Morris in Forbes, 1856, non Deshayes, 1851.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Oued Mourebeï sur la route de Merrakech” [Oued Mourebeï (?) at the road to Marrakech], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les eaux de l’ancien Léonthes” (Mousson 1854: 51) [in the Litani river], Lebanon.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis brevis Parreyss in Mousson, 1854, non Sowerby, 1826, for which already Blanckenhorn (1897) had introduced Melanopsis media as replacement name. Thus, Melanopsis moussoni is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis media.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Obviously unaware of the fact that variety names are available in nomenclature as species-group names, Kormos (1903) stated in the description of his new variety Melanopsis sikorai carinata that, if raised to species, he suggests “Melanopsis mucronifera” as name for the taxon. Both names were simultaneously published and are objective synonyms. Since Melanopsis carinata Kormos is a junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826, Melanopsis mucronifera is the valid name of the taxon. Neubauer et al. (2014d) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “multicostellata” as mentioned by Handmann (1887: 33) is an incorrect subsequent spelling. Wenz (1929: 2674) considered this variety as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903) by Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Riss/Würm end to early Würm Ice Age, Pleistocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Eger, az egri vár Zárkándy bástyájának vasúti átmetszése” [Eger, section at the railway at the Zarkandy bastion of the fortress Eger], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Magyar Állami Földtani Intézet (Hungarian Geological Museum), Budapest; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis tothi var. multifilosa Brusina, 1903. Neubauer et al. (2016a) attributed the species Melanopsis doboi to the genus Microcolpia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der ersten Thonbank des linken Orontesufers bei Dschisr esch-Schurr” [in the first clay bank at the left riverside of the Orontes near Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as “n. mut.” (see also discussion on p. 117) but clearly as a binomen and hence not infrasubspecific in the sense of ICZN Art. 45.6.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum; apparently based on an unpublished manuscript name from Ziegler and listed in synonymy of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804) by Brot (1879).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Environs d’Agora et d’Alhama (Aragon), en Espagne; Relizane, dans la plaine du Cheliff, en Algérie” [surroundings of Agora (?) and Alhama de Aragón (Spain); Relizane, in the Plaine du Chelif (Algeria)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ruisseau du puits artésien de Ngouça; Chetma, près de Biskra, et environs d’Ouargla, dans le sud de la province de Constantine” [creek from the artesian well of N’Goussa; Chetma near Biskra and in the surroundings of Ouargla], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Kobelt (1881) and Clessin (1890) attributed the name to Brot (1874), who did not name the variety but solely described it (nana = Latin “tiny”). Kobelt (1881) referred the name to Brot’s illustration, making it thereby available. However, the name is a junior homonym of Melania nana Lea & Lea, 1850.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced infrasubspecific taxon (“subvariety”), which is not ruled by the provisions of the Code.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally introduced as infrasubspecific taxon (“subvariety”) by Nevill (1884), but made available by Paetel (1888) who treated it as variety (Art. 45.5.1). Paetel clearly referred to the description of Nevill.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was based on Bonelli’s unpublished catalogue, but was first described in Viquesnel (1846) as “M.[elanopsis] narsolina” [sic]. However, the name Melanopsis narzolina - probably the “correct” spelling sensu Bonelli - has been in prevailing usage since then. For reasons of stability the name narzolina should be maintained according to Art. 33.3.1 (see Harzhauser et al. 2015: 10).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Unjustified emendation and therefore junior objective synonym of Melanopsis narzolina d’Archiac in Viquesnel, 1846.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Willmann (1981: 175) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis gorceixi proteus Tournouër, 1875.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Saint-Geours en Marensin, et ceux d’Abesse à Saint-Paul” (Grateloup 1828: 137) [Saint-Geours-de-Maremne and Abesse near Saint-Paul-lès-Dax], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Grateloup, 1828, non Olivier, 1804.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans l’Ohio et ses affluens” [in the Ohio river and its tributaries], United States.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des petits cours d’eau à Balade” [in small streams near Balade], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 456) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis brevis Morelet, 1857 (which is a junior homonym of Melanopsis brevis Sowerby, 1826; see Melanopsis moreleti Pallary, 1916).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 95) indicated collection numbers for “syntypes” illustrated in Brusina (1902), but it is uncertain whether the specimens were part of the original type series. They are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2533-179/1-4.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “nesicii” as mentioned in Stepanović (1938) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Gafsa, dans les eaux refroidies” [Gafsa, in cool waters], Tunisia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Qanat at Ginehkan near Kerman, S. Persia”, Iran.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, found only in the species list by Paetel (1888). He referred to Bourguignat (1884), but the name could not be found in that work.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Des bords du Chott Djerid, à Tozeur” [banks of the Chott el Djérid at Tozeur], Tunisia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis nobilis Seninski, 1905.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Save à Agram et la rivière entre Plaski et Ostaria (Croatie); le Danube à Ibraïla” [Sava river at Zagreb and river between Plaški and Oštarije (Croatia); Danube river at Brăila (Romania)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] esperi (Férussac, 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Handmann (1887) listed a Melanopsis varicosa nodescens. It is unclear whether he actually introduced a new variety or ranked the species described in 1882 as variety of Melanopsis varicosa Handmann, 1882. Wenz (1929: 2674) considered Melanopsis nodescens Handmann, 1882 as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Roccantica presso Poggio Mirteto; Fra Otricoli e le Vigne” (De Stefani 1880: 62–63) [Roccantica near Poggio Mirteto; between Otricoli and Le Vigne], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis nodosa sensu De Stefani, 1880, non Férussac, 1822. Wenz (1929: 2654) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Entre Otricoli et le Vigne, route de Rome à Foligno” [between Otricoli and Le Vigne, at the road from Rome to Foligno], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name first appeared in 1822 on the captions for plate 1 of the “Mélanopsides fossiles” in Férussac’s “Histoire naturelle” (see also introduction for details). While Férussac (1823) included also recent specimens under that name in his monograph on the Melanopsidae, the only specimen illustrated in 1822 in the “Histoire naturelle” was a fossil one from the Villafranchian of Italy. This fact remained widely unknown to biologists and paleontologists alike. The consequence, however, is that probably none of the specimens referred to as Melanopsis nodosa in the biological literature (e.g., Pallary 1939, Glaubrecht 1993, 1996) or the IUCN Red List (Van Damme 2014), which reports it from Anatolia and the Middle East, actually correspond to the real Melanopsis nodosa.

Fossil Italian specimens are often erroneously referred to as “Melanopsis affinis Férussac” or “Melanopsis antiqua Fèrussac” (Pallary 1916, Wenz 1929, Esu and Girotti 1975), both of which are unavailable names.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis nodosa Férussac, 1822. De Stefani (1877) introduced Melanopsis semperi as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Podvinje (Čaplja) [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; Kovačevac; Novska; Farkašić; Dubranjec”, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis nodosa Férussac, 1822. Wenz (1928a) introduced Melanopsis nodosula as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis nodosa Férussac, 1822. Pallary (1916: 80) introduced Melanopsis venusta as replacement name. Wenz (1929: 2673) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis nodosa Férussac, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, apparently based on an unused manuscript name from Parreyss (see Reeve 1860) or Stentz (see Brot 1874). Reeve (1860) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melania hollandri [sic]. If available, it would be a junior homonym of Melania nodosa Münster, 1841. Note that the latter species is certainly no Melanopsidae as it derives from the marine deposits of the Triassic St. Cassian Fm.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Podvinje (Čaplja) [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; Kovačevac; Novska; Farkašić; Dubranjec” (Brusina 1874: 41), Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melania costata nodosa Brusina, 1874, non Férussac, 1822 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 92).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2756) and Neubauer et al. (2016b: 23) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis inconstans Neumayr, 1869.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: V. Armiri” [Kos island: Armiri valley (?)], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis inconstans nodulosa Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aus dem Jarmūk bei el Hammi [...] auch bei el-Hāwijān [fossil]” [from the Yarmuk river at Al Ḩammah and as fossil near Jisr al Ḩāwī], Jordan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Noetling clearly referred to “Bourguignat’s new species”, which is why the authority should read as “Bourguignat in Noetling, 1886”. Heller and Sivan (2002b: 615) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis multiformis Blanckenhorn, 1897. Heller et al. (2005: 247) in turn treated it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis obliqua Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 88) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand when describing M. [constricta] subcostata (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2993-639.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis constricta subcostata Brusina, 1897, non Melanopsis subcostata d’Orbigny, 1850. The name “novskaensis” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2696) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Csingerthal bei Ajka” [Csinger valley near Ajka], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species was attributed to the genus Esperiana by Bandel and Riedel (1994: 20). That classification was, however, doubted by Neubauer et al. (2016a: 127) based on the large stratigraphic gap between this Cretaceous species and other representatives that appeared not before the late Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans l’Oued-Lisser, sur la route de Sidi-bel-Abess, à Tlemcen” [in the Oued Lisser (?), on the road to Sidi Bel Abbès, at Tlemcen], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat (1884) attributed the authority to himself, but even listed Gassies’ record in synonymy. Apparently, he did not consider a variety as a valid name that can result in homonymy (see also the introduction).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prope Cehejin Prov. Murcia” [near Cehegín, prov. Murcia], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species was described as “Melanopsis obesa Guirao mss.”. Although Brot (1868) denoted “(Guirao)” after the description of the species as well, it is clear from the text that Brot described it. Junior homonym of Melanopsis obesa Gassies, 1856. Bourguignat (1884) introduced Melanopsis guiraoi as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Jourdain et le lac de Tibériade” [river Jordan and Sea of Galilee], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. If available, it would be a junior homonym of Melanopsis obesa Gassies, 1856.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis obesa Gassies, 1856. Wenz (1928b) introduced Melanopsis doumerguei plena as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2492-138, 2493-139 (Milan et al. 1974: 96).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis obesa Gassies, 1856. It was considered as a junior synonym of Melanopsis pygmaea Hörnes, 1856 by Wenz (1929: 2814).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De l’Aïn bou Smelal près de Tétouan” [‘Aïn bou Smelal (?) near Tetouan], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Bélus, près de Saint-Jean-d’Acre” [in the Na’aman river, near Acre], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat (1884) denoted the authority as “Letourneux, 1882”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller and Sivan (2002a: 49) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis multiformis Blanckenhorn, 1897. Heller et al. (2005: 244) in turn treated it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der Dreissensiaschicht von Dschisr esch-Schurr” [in the Dreissena layers at Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Quellen des Chabur bei Ras-el-Ain” [source of Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis obsoleta Fuchs, 1873.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Palmyre, dans un ruisseau et dans la rivière Ephéca” [Palmyra, in a stream and the river Epheca (?)], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis obsoleta Fuchs, 1873.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Retheuil près de Pierre-Fonds” [Retheuil near Pierrefonds, Dép. Aisne], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Sandberger (1872: 202) classified the species within his new genus Coptostylus (Thiaridae), which was followed by Wenz (1929: 2570).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Meknès, près de anciennes écuries” [Meknes, near the old stables], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis obtusa Deshayes, 1824.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nevill (1884) first mentioned the name “acuticarinata” [sic] for an infrasubspecific taxon (“subvariety”), which he briefly described. Paetel (1888) made the name available by ranking it as species-group name and referring to the description of Nevill (Art. 45.5.1). Although he obviously “misspelt” the name, ocuticarinata remains the valid spelling because Nevill’s “acuticarinata” is not available as species-group name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. If available, it would be a junior homonym of Melanopsis oliva De Cristofori & Jan, 1832.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Am. mer.” [South America], indicated in the previous part of the same work (“Conchylia terrestria et fluviatilia [...]”, p. 7; there, the name is a nomen nudum).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Entre Ain-Taib et Alep, à Sadjour-Sou; [...] du Nahr-el-Kelb, près Beyrouth; de divers cours d’eau du Liban; de Serghaia dans l’ouady Baradah près de Damas; de la fontaine Jérémie près de Jéricho; environs de Constantinople” [Gaziantep (Turkey) and Aleppo (Syria), at Sadjour-Sou (?); in Nahr el-Kalb near Beirut (Lebanon); in various streams of Lebanon; in Serghaia (?) in River Barada near Damascus (Syria); Jeremiah Fountain (?) near Jericho (Palestine); near Istanbul (Turkey)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Nefta, dans les canaux d’arrosement et à El-Hammam, près Tozer” [at Nefta, in the irrigation channel, and at El-Hamma-Djerid near Tozeur], Tunisia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis olivula Grateloup, 1838. Pallary (1916: 84) was aware of the homonymy issue but did not introduce a replacement name for he considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis doumeti Letourneux & Bourguignat, 1887.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Graben unterhalb der Gemeinde-Baumschule östlich von Oltszakadát” [trench below communal tree nursery, east of Săcădate], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Plostina, à Leurda et à Stângaceana, dans la vallée de Motru; à Valea-lui-Câne, dans la vallée de Gilortu; à Breasta, à Bocovatz et à Bâzdâna, dans la vallée de Jiu; à Beceni, dans la vallée de Slanic de Buzau; à Plaiu et à Chiojdeni, dans la vallée de Râmnicu-Sarat” [at Ploștina, at Leurda and at Stângăceaua, in the valley of the river Motru; at Gilortu in the valley of the river Gilortu; at Breasta, at Bucovăț and at Bâzdâna, in the valley of the river Jiu; at Beceni, in the valley of the river Slănic; at Plaiu and at Chiojdeni, in the valley of the river Râmnic], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bečić; Podvinje (Čaplja) [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; Sibinj”, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 95) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3206-852/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Spoleto [...], Orciano [...], fra S. Gemini e Carsoli” [Spoleto, Orciano Pisano, Carsoli near San Gemini], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania buccinoidea sensu Férussac, 1823, non Olivier, 1801 (partim) as well as for formerly misidentified Melanopsis narzolina. Esu and Girotti (1975: 251) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “D’un puits, profond de 25 mètres, situé dans la propriété Lamur, sur la rive gauche d’un ravinement creusé par les eaux pluviales dans une dépression de terrain, perpendiculaire au chemin d’Aïn Beïda” (p. 284) [from a well, 25 m deep, located in the village Lamur (near Oran) on the left bank of a ravine carved by rainwater in a depression in the ground, perpendicular to the path from ‘Aïn el Beïda], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary cited in the synonymy list his paper on the fauna of the “Berbérie”, which appeared in the Journal de Conchyliologie. That work, however, was not published before March 1928.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: Von dem Busch” mentioned in Mousson (1854: 50)

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, listed by Mousson without any explanation.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of Eginea Pacaud & Harzhauser, 2012 (Pachychilidae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Since Paludina Férussac, 1812 is a junior objective synonym of Viviparus Montfort, 1810, this species is a junior homonym of Vivipara ornata Neumayr in Neumayr & Paul, 1875. Wenz (1928a) recombined the species with Amphimelania and introduced Amphimelania fuchsi as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’Oronte à Djisr ech Chogour” [in the Orontes at Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis praemorsa sensu Cerulli-Irelli, 1914, non Linnaeus, 1758.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Paleontology, University of Vienna; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for “Melania buccinoidea var. a” in Férussac (1823: 149, pl. 1 [= 7], fig. 1), non Olivier, 1801.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Suter (1893: 139) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Zemelanopsis trifasciata (Gray in Dieffenbach, 1843).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2763), who erroneously considered the taxon as a nomen nudum, listed it in synonymy of Melanopsis kleinii Kurr, 1856.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Danube au-dessus de Routschouk (Bulgarie)” [in the Danube river below Ruse], Bulgaria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Girotti (1972: 232) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Vasilios Formation, middle Tortonian, late Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dermen Deressi 400 m westlich des Asklepion, ca. 3 km westlich von Kos-Ort/Kos” [Dermen Deressi 400 m west of Asklepion, ca. 3 km west of Kos city, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Institute, University of Kiel, Germany; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Guadalquivir entre Séville et Cordoue” [in the Guadalquivir river between Sevilla and Córdoba], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Watelet attributed the authority to Deshayes, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Locard (1883a: 202). Introduced for “Melanopsis costata var.” in Kobelt (1880: 17, pl. 188, fig. 1906). Heller et al. (2005: 246) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis jordanica Roth, 1839.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2534-180/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 95).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “oxicanthe” as mentioned in Miletić-Spajić (1961: 252) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sierra de la Pinada en Sayatón (Guadalajara)”, Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les sources de Mézérib, au N. O. de Derâa (Syrie méridionale)” [in the sources of the Muzayrīb, northwest of Dar’ā], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Save près d’Agram” [Sava river at Zagreb], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia cornea (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 213 (Milošević 1962: 23).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Du puits Karoubi” (Pallary 1901a: 178) [from the well Karoubi], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis acuminata Pallary, 1901, non Gümbel, 1861.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 248) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3660-1300/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 95).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2013: 135) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: Almera & Bofill y Poch in Almera, 1894

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Late Messinian–early Zanclean, late Miocene–early Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Palaeontological Institute and Museum University of Hamburg, coll. no. 4269.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2540-186/1-4 (Milan et al. 1974: 100).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Krain, im Gurkfluss” (Clessin 1890: 686) [in the river Gurk], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1878) introduced it as “Melanopsis pardalis. Mhlf. Mss.” in synonymy of Hemisinus esperi (Férussac, 1823) [currently in Esperiana]. Clessin (1890) made the name available by treating it as valid name (see Note 2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2566) considered the species as a junior synonym of Coptostylus albidus (Lamarck, 1822) (Thiaridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Hungaria” [no locality indicated], Hungary? (at that time, the kingdom Hungary covered large parts of Romania and northern Croatia).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Philippi attributed the authority to Johann Georg Megerle von Mühlfeld, apparently based on an “in schedis” determination. The name “parreyssi” as mentioned in Brusina (1903), Kormos (1905) and Paucă (1937) is an incorrect subsequent spelling (see also Neubauer et al. 2014d).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary (1916, 1920) erroneously treated “parva” as available name attributed to Férussac (1823), who solely used the word as descriptive term (Latin “small”). The name became nevertheless available from Pallary (1916) who associated the name with an illustration in Férussac (1823: pl. 8, fig. 5). Cossmann and Peyrot (1918: 485) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis subbuccinoides d’Orbigny, 1852.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Krain” [Carniola, a historical region that comprised parts of present-day Slovenia; no locality indicated].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Brot (1862). The name was not found in Rossmässler (1839), to whom Brot (1862, 1874) referred.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Le Jourdain, à 4 kilomètres au-dessus de la Mer Morte; Ain-el-Mellaha, dans la plaine du Bahr-el-Houlé” [Jordan river, 4 km north of the Dead Sea; Aïn Mallahah, in the plains of the Hula valley], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis olivula parvula Grateloup, 1838 (see Note 1). Heller et al. (2005: 245) considered the variety a synonym of Melanopsis lampra Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Del Tortonese” [from the region of Tortona], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bellardi and Michelotti attributed the authority to Bonelli (1827), which is an unpublished collection catalogue. Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Wenz (1929: 2876).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Comuna Vingard, 15 km NE de Sebeș-Alba”, Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geology and Geophysics, University of Bucharest; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria, coll. no. 1994/148.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Vallée de la Cettina” [Cetina river valley], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2495-141/1-3 (Milan et al. 1974: 95).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Brusina (1893). Not a homonym of Melanopsis paulovici [sic] as considered by Pallary (1916), who invalidly introduced Melanopsis ripajensis as replacement name. Note that Art. 58.4. (regarding the use of u or v for the same Latin letter) does not apply here, because the names are not based on Latin words but on the names of two different persons.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Wenz (1929: 2877). Note that Wenz gave the name as “pecchioli”, which is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De la source de la Moulouiah, au nord de Lalla-Maghnia, près des frontières du Maroc” [in the source of the river Moulouya, north of Maghnia, near the border to Morocco], Morocco or Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1882”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Colli torinesi, [...] presso Tetti Varetti” [Torino hills, near Tetti Varetti], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “pinchinati” as mentioned in Brot (1879: 440) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2532-178/1-4 (Milan et al. 1974: 95).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Environs de Krapina-Toeplitz (Croatie)” [surroundings of Krapinske toplice], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia acicularis (Férussac, 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: First mentioned as nomen nudum in Pérès (1939), but described and made available by Pérès (1946). In both works Pérès obviously used the name not as a separate taxon but rather as descriptive term to fit existing species into his morphological concept. The name is in fact a junior objective synonym of several different species.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2763) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis kleinii Kurr, 1856.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les séguias du Guers” [in the irrigation channel of Guers], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis percarinata Förster, 1892.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Late Sarmatian (sensu lato), Khersonian, late Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “pergamenica” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2804) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bečić; Podvinje (Čaplja) [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; Sibinj; Kovačevac; Novska; Moslavina” (Brusina 1874: 41–42), Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Probably a junior synonym: introduced for Melania costata sensu Brusina, 1874, non Olivier, 1804, which has been considered to be the same species as Melania costata sensu Neumayr, 1869 (e.g., Neumayr and Paul 1875: 41). For that misidentified record, Brusina (1884a: 168) had already introduced Melanopsis croatica as new name (see also discussion of Melanopsis pseudocostata Oppenheim, 1890). Not included in the Fossilium Catalogus of Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Oued Fès, à 1.500 mètres en amont de la ville” [Oued Fes, at 1.500 m above the city], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 2888 (Milošević 1962: 24).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Pavlović (1922: 49).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Lectotype designation by Milan et al. (1974: 84) invalid: it is uncertain whether the specimen illustrated by Brusina (1902) was part of the original type series. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2484-130.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivières de Carniole; la Save à Steinbrück” [rivers in Carniola, a historical region that comprised parts of present-day Slovenia; in the Sava river near Zidani Most], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1880”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] acroxia Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Willmann (1981: 127) considered this taxon as a synonym of Melanopsis vandeveldi Bukowski, 1892.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Bélus [près de Saint-Jean-d’Acre, en Syrie]” [in the Na’aman river, near Acre], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The spelling “phaeniciaca” on p. 76 is obviously a typesetting mistake regarding the ligature (æ instead of œ). Heller et al. (2002: 596) considered the species (misspelt as “phoeneciaca”) a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804). Heller et al. (2005: 244) treated it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lampra Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Auf zwei Puncten der Brandenberger Ache. Ungefähr ¾ Stunde nördlich von Binneck [...]. Etwa eine Viertelstunde unter Binneck [...] am linken Ufer der Ache” [At two points along the Brandenberger Ache: about three quarters of an hour north of Pinegg and a quarter of an hour south of Pinegg in Tyrol], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: First mentioned as nomen nudum in Pichler (1856), who attributed the authority to Hörnes. It was validly described by Stoliczka (1860: 487, pl. 1, figs 6–9), but not considered a Melanopsidae there or later (see, e.g., Yen 1958: 206).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: After Wenz (1929: 2505) this species belongs in the genus Semisinus P. Fischer, 1885, which is an unjustified emendation of Hemisinus Swainson, 1840 (Thiaridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la Save à Agram et à Sissek. Dans la rivière, entre Plaski et Ostaria (Croatie)” [Sava river at Zagreb and Sisak. In the river between Plaški and Oštarije], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1882”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] servainiana Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “En Croatie, au pont de la Save à Agram, ainsi qu’à Steinbrück; [...] en Bosnie, dans les rivières de Zenica et de la Migliaska à Sérajewo” [in Croatia, at the bridge of the Sava river in Zagreb, as well as Zidani Most (Slovenia); in Bosnia, in the rivers Zenica and Miljacka near Sarajevo].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Servain (1884: 379). Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1880”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Harris (1899: 77) designated a lectotype, which is stored in the collection of the National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, DC, coll. no. 638788 (Palmer and Brann 1966: 755).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Palmer and Brann (1966: 755) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis anita Aldrich, 1886. According to Allmon (1990: 63), neither of both species belongs to the Melanopsidae.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis doumergueiobesa Pallary, 1901, non Gassies, 1856 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geological Sciences of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, coll. no. 4603.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Vallée de la Cettina” [Cetina river valley], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Viar et le Carbanès, entre Cordoue et Séville (Espagne)” [in the Río Viar and Río Corbones, between Córdoba and Sevilla], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanoptychia pleuroplagia Bourguignat, 1880. It was considered as a junior synonym of Melanopsis sevillensis by Pallary (1916: 86).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ruisseaux de l’île d’Ivice, dans les Baléares” [stream on the island of Ibiza], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “У засеоку Рамаћи [...] у Рипњу” [from the village Ramača and from Ripanj], Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 794 (Milošević 1962: 24).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Tout près d’Oudjda, à 4 kilom. S.-E., sourdent les belles sources de Sidi-Yahia qui alimentent une véritable oasis, puis la ville d’Oudjda, et vont finalement se déverser dans l’oued Isly” [near Oujda, 4 km southeast, at the sources of Sidi Yahya that feed an oasis and the city of Oujda, and ultimately will flow into the Oued Isly], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans une source tiède à proximité de la Moulouïa” [in a warm source close to the river Moulouya], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis plicata Pallary, 1911.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis barbini plicata Pallary, 1911 (see Note 1). Heller et al. (2005: 254) considered the variety as a junior synonym of Melanopsis infracincta Martens, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pannonian, late Miocene; late Burdigalian to early Langhian, early–middle Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 96) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2976-622/1-2.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2016b: 23) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis inconstans Neumayr, 1869.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. If available, it would be a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis themaki, because Brusina (1903) indicated it as the typical form of the species, as well as a junior homonym of Melanopsis inconstansplicatula Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1). Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis inconstans plicatula Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1). Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“plicatulus”), but Melanopsis is feminine, which is why the name must be “plicatula”. Junior homonym of Melanopsis inconstans plicatula Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1). Pallary (1916: 84) introduced Melanopsis similis as replacement name. Wenz (1929: 2674) listed both names in synonymy of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania buccinoidea sensu Cossmann, 1909 (p. 171, pl. 3, figs 21–22) and Cossmann, 1910 (in Cossmann and Pissarro 1906–1913: pl. 19, fig. 118–1). Wenz (1929: 2662) considered it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis antidiluviana.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis polita Pallary, 1916.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Pylle und Antimachia” [between Pýli and Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “polyptychia” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2806) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species was attributed to the Melanopsis (Stilospirula?) by Beu and Maxwell (1990: 141).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “En Carmiole [sic], en Croatie, et en Dalmatie, notamment dans la Cettina” [in Carniola (a historical region that comprised parts of present-day Slovenia), Croatia and Dalmiata, especially in the Cetina river].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Villa and Villa (1841: 36) and Brusina (1867: 86). Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1877”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geological Sciences of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, coll. no. 3190.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Porumbaru attributed the authority to Brusina, but there is not clear evidence that the description really derived from that author. The name “porumbarui” as mentioned in Fontannes (1887: 336), Stefanescu (1896: 134) and Wenz (1929: 2806) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as nomen nudum in Papp (1951: 107, 108, 124, 127). Although he mentioned differences from other melanopsids, he did not state any morphological characters.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Weganrisse und Regenrisse 3 Km N Antirrion in Akarnanien” [outcrops 3 km north of Antirrio], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Senckenberg Forschungsinstitut und Naturmuseum Frankfurt; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsisimpressaposterior Papp, 1953 (see Note 1). Neubauer et al. (2014a) introduced Melanopsis gearyae as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Danube. [...] non-seulement de Brahilov, mais encore des environs de Belgrade” [in the Danube; not only from Brăila (Romania), but also from the surroundings of Belgrade (Serbia)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Coptostylus is at present considered to belong in the family Thiaridae (Pacaud and Le Renard 1995: 156).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Save à Agram, à Sissek et près de Belgrade” [Sava river at Zagreb, at Sisak (Croatia) and near Belgrade (Serbia)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia cornea (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “The type-locality of the Upper Pliocene sediments or the ‘Erq el-Ahmar Formation in the Jordan Valley south of the Sea of Galilee” [i.e. ‘Erq el-Ahmar (also known as Gesher)], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Paleontology Collection of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Sometimes incorrectly listed as the type species of Melanopsis (e.g., Wenz 1929: 2647; Heller et al. 1999: 56; Esu and Girotti 2015b: 150).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name Buccinum praerosum, commonly combined as Melanopsis praerosa, is an unjustified emendation and therefore a junior objective synonym of Buccinum praemorsum Linnaeus, 1758.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Hauptstraße bei Avcilar, nahe der Abzweigung nach Ambarliköy” [main road at Avcılar, near the diversion to Ambarlı, west of Istanbul], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum; mentioned as “new species” in Gillet et al. (1978) but left undescribed.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of Faunopsis Gill, 1863. It was considered as a junior synonym of Faunus ater (Linnaeus, 1758), the type species of the genus Faunus Montfort, 1810 (Pachychilidae), by Starmühlner (1974: 132).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2675) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Papp (1953b: 134) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Wenz (1929: 2876).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le eaux de la fontaine de l’Élysée, à Jéricho; [...] des environs de Beyrouth; [...] dans les eaux du lac d’Antioche” [from the spring of Elysium (?) at Jericho (Palestine); from the surroundings of Beirut (Lebanon); from the waters of Lake Anuk (also as Amik) (Turkey)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2719) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prope vicum Antimaki” [near the village Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species epithet is a noun in apposition (named after the Greek God Proteus) and needs not to agree in gender with the generic name (Art. 31.2.1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Graben unterhalb der Gemeinde-Baumschule östlich von Oltszakadát” [trench below communal tree nursery, east of Săcădate], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geological Sciences of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, coll. no. 3186.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “pseudaustriaca” as mentioned in Lueger (1980: 117) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Papkesi [Papkeszi] near the eastern shore of Lake Balaton”, Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Palaeontological Institute and Museum University of Hamburg, coll. no. 4266.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Cigelnik; [...] Graben zwischen Čapla und der Podwiner Kirche; [...] Thal hinter der Podwiner Kirche; [...] Sibin; [...] Repušnica” (Neumayr and Paul 1875: 41) [Ciglenik; trench between Čaplja and the church of Podvinje; valley behind the church of Podvinje; Sibinj; Repušnica], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Different concepts of this species were applied in the literature and created considerable confusion. Oppenheim introduced the name clearly for the misidentified record of Melania costata sensu Neumayr in Neumayr & Paul, 1875 (p. 41), non Olivier, 1804 from Slavonia, despite referring about Greek material. Later, however, he considered the name as rectification also for Melania costata sensu Fuchs, 1877 from Megara and sensu Tournouër, 1876 from Kos Island (Oppenheim 1891: 465). This fact remained unnoticed by Wenz (1929: 2808), who treated Melanopsis pseudocostata as replacement name of the latter two records (Fuchs, Tournouër) but not of Neumayr and Paul’s species.

In addition, there are three other new names proposed for misidentified Melania costata from the Pliocene of Slavonia, i.e., Melanopsis croatica Brusina, 1884 (for Melania costata sensu Neumayr, 1869), Melanopsis cosmanni Pallary, 1916 [= cossmanni, just. emend.] (for Melania costata sensu Cossmann, 1909) and Melanopsis permutabilis Pallary, 1920 (for Melania costata sensu Brusina, 1874). Note that Wenz (1929) erroneously considered Melanopsis cosmanni a replacement name of Neumayr’s (1869) record.

Wenz obviously considered all erroneous “Melania costata” records from Slavonia to represent the same species and synonymized them with Melanopsis cosmanni, but was unaware that Melanopsis croatica Brusina, 1884 is the first available name for them. Although the four names (croatica, pseudocostata, cosmanni, permutabilis) likely refer to the very same species they are based on different specimens and thus no objective synonyms.

For the record by Tournouër (1876) from Kos Island, Pallary (1929: 119) introduced Melanopsis sculptilis as replacement name. The misidentified Melanopsis costata sensu Fuchs, 1877 from Megara, however, is still nameless.
The name “pseudodecorata” mentioned by Cossmann (1909: 178) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2733) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fusulatina Sacco, 1895.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Papp (1951: 115, 130 [as species], 147–148, 150 [as subspecies]).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as nomen nudum in Papp (1951: 107, 123, 124, 127).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: vicino a Cardamena” [Kos island: close to Kardámaina], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Oncophora Beds, middle Burdigalian, early Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Rather unprecisely given as “Kirchberger Schichten Mährens” [Kirchberg Formation in Moravia] by Sandberger (1886). Later specified as “Oslawan” [Oslavany] by Rzehak (1893: 174), Czech Republic.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Hempstead [...]. Headon Hill; Hordwell. [...] High Cliff”, United Kingdom.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced (as “pseudo-subulata”) for a part of Sowerby’s material for Melanopsis fusiformis Sowerby, 1822 (Sowerby 1821–1823: pl. 332, figs 6–7) as well as for misidentified Melanopsis subulata sensu Forbes, 1856, non Sowerby, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Podvinje (Čaplja) [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; Kovačevac”, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 96) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3741-1381.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “pterochyla” as mentioned in Pană (2003: 322) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced to replace - for whatever reason - the variety “gracilis” mentioned by Locard (1883a: 288), making pulchella its junior objective synonym. Melanopsis gracilis Locard, 1883 is a junior homonym of Melanopsis gracilis Brusina, 1874, which makes pulchella the next available name. However, Melanopsis costatapulchella is a homonym of the simultaneously introduced Melanopsis seignetti pulchella Bourguignat, 1884 (see Note 1). The action of a First Reviser is required to determine which of both pulchella is to be treated as valid.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “[Dans les oasis du sud de la province d’Oran; [...] l’oasis Sidi Yousef, à l’extrême sud de la frontière du Maroc; [...] ruisseau d’eau chaude à Ouargla]” [in the oases in the south of the province Oran; oasis Sidi Youcef, at the far southern border of Morocco; hot water stream at Ouargla], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously introduced Melania costata pulchella Bourguignat, 1884 (see Note 1). The action of a First Reviser is required to determine which of both pulchella is to be treated as valid.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans une source entre Sidi Abdallah et Koudiat (région de Taza) et dans l’Innaouen, à Sidi Abdallah” [in a source between Douar Sidi Abdellah and Douar El Koudiat (Taza region) and in the Oued Abiod (?) in Douar Sidi Abdellah], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis costata pulchella Bourguignat, 1884 and Melanopsis seignetti pulchella Bourguignat, 1884 (simultaneously published; no priority fixed yet; see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2491-137/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 84).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Kollmann (1984: 57) considered this species as a junior synonym of Megalonoda reussi (Hörnes, 1855).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rives de la Save près Sissek, en Slavonie” [Sava river near Sisak in Slavonia], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Servain, 1884”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] acroxia Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Brunn, Gumpoldskirchen, Guntramsdorf, Inzersdorf, Arsenal in Wien, Kroisbach bei Oedenburg” [Brunn am Gebirge, Gumpoldskirchen, Guntramsdorf, Inzersdorf and Arsenal in Vienna (Austria), Fertőrákos (Hungary)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Hörnes attributed the authority to Partsch, apparently based on an “in schedis” determination.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Danube, où elle a été rencontrée çà et là depuis Buda-Pesth jusqu’à Ibraila; [...] Pregrada, près de Krapina, en Croatie” [in the Danube river, where it was found here and there between Budapest (Hungary) and Brăila (Romania); Pregrada, near Krapina (Croatia)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat (1884) referred to a publication by Lang (1823: 430) [not 1833 as stated by Brot 1879], who mentioned “Melanopsis pyramidalis (mihi)” [nomen nudum] in a species list. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia acicularis (Férussac, 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Grossalmerode, Oberzwehren, Mardorf bei Wabern, Frielendorf, Kirchhain, Dannerod, Ofleiden, Mardorf an der Ohm” (Ludwig 1865: 71), Germany.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis praerosa [= Melanopsis praemorsa] sensu Ludwig, 1865, non Linnaeus, 1758. It was regarded a junior synonym by Wenz (1929: 2740) because Sandberger (1873: 315) had already introduced Melanopsis hassiaca as replacement name for misidentified Melanopsis praemorsa from that region and time period. Since Sandberger did not explicitly refer to Ludwig’s material, pyramidalis and hassiaca are not objective synonyms.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De Binisalem et de Selva” [from Binissalem and Selva, Mallorca], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. Given as “Melania pyrguloeformis” on p. 328. The name was probably intended as “pyrgulaeformis”, but the ligature was mixed up during typesetting. Hermite listed the name in a section called “Espèces nouvelles citées et non décrites” [= “new species identified and not described”], where he listed 18 new names that he intended to describe in the second volume of his “Études géologiques sur les îles Baléares”. That part, however, has never been published, probably because Hermite died in 1880.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2758) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis inermis Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 222 (Milošević 1962: 22).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Čaplathal bei Podwin” [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species epithet is a noun in apposition (pyrum = Latin “pear”) and needs not to agree in gender with the generic name (Art. 31.2.1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum (Brusina apparently considered the term self-explanatory). Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Du puits Karoubi” (Pallary 1901a: 178) [from the well Karoubi], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as replacement name for Melanopsis acuminata Pallary, 1901, non “Sandberger” [act. Gümbel, 1861], for which Wenz (1919a: 73) had already introduced the replacement name Melanopsis pallaryi. Thus, Melanopsis raphidia is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis pallaryi.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Plate 13 of Sandberger’s monograph appeared in 1871, whereas the description on p. 222 was issued in 1872 (Woodward 1906). Erroneously given as “Melanopsis proboscidea Desh.” in plate captions.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aллювия VII террасы р. Днестр у с. Роги” [Alluvial terrace VII of the Dniestr river near Rogi], Ukraine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geological Sciences of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, coll. no. 5243.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2541-187/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 100).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Papp (1953b) gave Melanopsis bouei spinosa Handmann, 1882 and Melanopsis bouei ventricosa Handmann, 1882 in synonymy of Melanopsis rarispina, although both were published earlier. The name ventricosa Handmann is a junior homonym of Melanopsis ventricosa Neumayr, 1880 and thus invalid, but spinosa is available and has priority over rarispina.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “De la petite rivière de Guadaira qui se jette dans le Guadalquivir” [in the little river Guadaira which flows into the Guadalquivir], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bečić; Podvinje (Čaplja) [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; Sibinj; Nova Gradiška; Kovačevac; Moslavina; Farkašić”, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Oberes Vokasia-Tal südöstlich von Kos-Ort/Kos (Profil K 1)” [upper Vokasia valley, section K 1 (near Paradeísi)], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
