tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Institute, University of Kiel, Germany; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Im südlichen Muldenflügel des Sonnberges (p. 334–335) [on the southern mountainside of the Sonnberg (near Guttaring, Carinthia)], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Meseta de Requena y Ayora (Valencia)” (Royo Gomez 1922: 110) [Plateau of Requena and Ayora], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Royo Gomez, 1922, non Olivier, 1804.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’intérieur de la Nouvelle-Calédonie” [the interior of New Caledonia].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 454) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis carinata Gassies, 1861, which is a junior homonym of Melanopsis carinata Sowerby, 1826 (see Melanopsis ducosi Pallary, 1916).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aus der Gams, nordwestlich von Hieflau in Steiermark” [from Gams, northwest of Hieflau in Styria], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Kollmann (1984: 57) designated a lectotype, which is stored in the collection of the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna (coll. no. 1856/3/4).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of the melanopsid genus Megalonoda Kollmann, 1984.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis incerta Fuchs, 1877, non Férussac, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Falsan and Locard (1879).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Fès, dans les séguias. Ras el Mâ, à 16 kilom. de Fès” [Fes, in irrigiation channels; Ras el Ma, 16 km from Fes], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neumayr mentioned uncertainties regarding the locality Ciglenik because he had lost the original collection label. The species epithet is a noun in apposition and needs not to agree in gender with the generic name (Art. 31.2.1). Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Brusina (1897: 6), Cossmann (1909: 126) and Wenz (1929: 2876).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Spring from the Southeastern Rich region”, Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museo Malacologico di Cupra Marittima, Italy; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced by Pallary (1916) for the alleged junior homonym “Melanopsis paulovici Brusina, 1902”, non Bourguignat, 1880. However, Brusina (1902) had named his species “pavlovici”, which makes Melanopsis ripajensis its junior objective synonym. Note that Art. 58.4. (regarding the use of u or v for the same Latin letter) does not apply here, because the names are not based on Latin words but on the names of two different persons.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2530-176/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 86).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis haueri serbica Brusina, 1902, non Brusina, 1893 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 68) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia coutagniana (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Кулеви (быв. Редут-Кале)” [Q’ulevi (also read as Kulevi), former Redut-Kale], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Prope Kanala [...]; insula Ouen” (Gassies 1870: 148) [near Canala; Île Ouen], New Caledonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis fusiformis Gassies, 1870, non Sowerby, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ruisseau de Pregrada, près Krapina-Toeplilz, en Croatie” [Pregrada river near Krapinske toplice], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1880”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] esperi (Férussac, 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis cariosa sensu Rossmässler, 1839, non Linnaeus, 1767.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, apparently based on an unpublished manuscript name from Ziegler and listed in synonymy of Melanopsis buccinoidea (Olivier, 1801) by Brot (1879).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: V. Iracli, V. S. Giorgio” [Kos island: Irakli valley, Ágios Geórgios valley (?)], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb; no number indicated (Milan et al. 1974: 96).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2824) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis senatoria Handmann, 1887.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: D’Orbigny (1850) considered this species a Melania and a junior secondary homonym of Melania rugosa Lea, 1842 (which in turn is a replacement name for Melanopsis corrugata Lea, 1841, non Lamarck, 1804). However, the first one was published earlier (August 1842 vs. November/December 1842; for details on publication dates of Matheron’s work see note at the beginning of the Reference section).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: It is uncertain whether the single specimen from Wittmannsdorf near Leobersdorf stored in the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna, is really the only specimen left of the original type series (i.e., holotype by monotypy), as was considered by Fischer (1996b: 23). The statement by Fischer (1996b) did not suffice for a valid lectotype designation.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis rugosa Matheron, 1842. Neubauer et al. (2014c: 17) introduced Melanopsis wolfgangfischeri as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 94) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen is part of the original type series and whether it was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2983-629.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis rugosa Matheron, 1842. Neubauer et al. (2011: 205) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lanzaeana Brusina, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Riss/Würm end to early Würm Ice Age, Pleistocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Eger, az egri vár Zárkándy bástyájának vasúti átmetszése” [Eger, section at the railway at the Zarkandy bastion of the fortress Eger], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Magyar Állami Földtani Intézet (Hungarian Geological Museum), Budapest; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis rugosa Matheron, 1842. Neubauer et al. (2016a) attributed the species Melanopsis doboi to the genus Microcolpia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Rhône Basin? (no exact locality given), France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally written as “rugoso-carinata”. Based on material from the Rhône Basin, not Italy as claimed by Wenz (1929); probably the taxon was mixed up by Italian authors cited by Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis tothi: Brusina (1903) indicated it as the typical form of the species. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced in synonymy of Melania buccinoidea by Brot (1879), referring to an “in schedis” name by Tarnier (see Note 2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “[In loco Bukovatzu dicto, prope urbem Rumaniae Craiova]” [Bucovăț, near Craiova], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, based on an “in schedis” name in the collection of Kucik (also read as “Kutschig”).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2505-151/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 96).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Rather unspecifically indicated in text as “Cours d’eau du Sahara” [rivers of the Sahara], but more precisely as “D’Aïn-Sidi-Taifour; Ouargla; fontaine d’Oumach près de Biskra” [Sidi Taifour; Ouargla; Oumache spring near Biskra, Algeria] in the plate captions.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la Save, au-dessous d’Agram, en Croatie” [in the Sava river below Zagreb], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally written as “Saint-Simoniana”. Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] acroxia Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Fossés d’eau stagnante au camp des Pins, et çà et là dans le Liban (Syrie)” [ditches of stagnant water in the “camp des Pins” (not found, said to be near Beirut), and here and there in Lebanon].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Locard (1883a: 201). Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1880”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Eliasbrunnen bei Jericho” (Kobelt 1880: 17) [Naẖal Elisha‘ (?) near Jericho], Palestine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Kobelt, 1880 (p. 17, pl. 188, fig. 1901), non Olivier, 1804. Bourguignat denoted authority as “Letourneux, 1882”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author. Heller et al. (2005: 248) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis saulcyi Bourguignat, 1853.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sakarya başi, main spring of Sakarya river near village Çifteler, 60 km SE Eskişehir, 160 km WSW of Ankara”, Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Senckenberg Forschungsinstitut und Naturmuseum Frankfurt, coll. no. SMF 232008.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally written as “san-migueli”. Probably not a Melanopsidae.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Artouze, en Syrie” [Artouz (or ‘Arţūz), 15 km W of Damascus, Rif Dimashq], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“scabridus”), but Melanopsis is feminine, which is why the name must be “scabrida”. Probably not a Melanopsidae (perhaps a Hydrobiidae or Pomatiopsidae?).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: V. Iracli e varie località della zona centrale fossilifera” [Kos island: Irakli valley and different locations around the central fossiliferous zone], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not included in the Fossilium Catalogus by Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as nomen nudum in Papp (1951: 109, 147). Junior homonym of Melanopsis affinis scalariformis Handmann, 1882 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’Aïn-Fekan, source d’eau chaude, située entre Mascara et Saïda [...]; l’Oued-M’Ilouya, frontière du Maroc” [‘Aïn Fekan, hot spring between Mascara and Saïda; river Moulouya, at the border to Morocco], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis scalaris Gassies, 1856. Pallary (1916: 83) introduced Melanopsis limbata as replacement name. Wenz (1929: 2741) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis haueri Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Au pont de la Save, près d’Agram” [at the bridge of the Sava river near Zagreb], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not available from Brot (1879: 431), who listed the name (“Melanopsis scalaris Parreyss in sched.”) as synonym of Melanopsis Parreyssii var. β, which he introduced there with a short Latin description. Further below on p. 431, Brot even associated scalaris with an illustration of a specimen from Deva in Romania (pl. 46, fig. 15). However, the name was explicitly referred to as synonym of the (unnamed) variety β, which is not a valid name, and thus the requirements of Art. 11.6 (and therefore Art. 12.1) are not met. Westerlund (1886) was the first to describe it and attributed the authority to Parreyss. It is a junior homonym of Melanopsis scalaris Gassies, 1856. Neubauer et al. (2014: 125) considered it as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Plan de Campagne bei Septême (B.-du-Rhône)” [Plan de Campagne near Septèmes-les-Vallons], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melania scalaroides Briart & Cornet, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn Mélias, près de Figuig” [Ain Melias near Figuig], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Breasta, dans la vallée de Jiu” [near Breasta, in the valley of the river Jiu], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “scansorie” as mentioned in Pană et al. (1981: 117) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Pylle und Antimachia” [between Pýli and Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Willmann (1981: 171) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis sporadum Tournouër, 1876.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Tournouër, 1876. It was indirectly considered as a junior synonym by Willmann (1981: 177), who was unaware of Pallary’s replacement name but synonymized Melania costata sensu Tournouër, 1876 with Melanopsis heldreichi Neumayr, 1880.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les oasis du sud de la province d’Oran; [...] l’oasis Sidi Yousef, à l’extrême sud de la frontière du Maroc; [...] ruisseau d’eau chaude à Ouargla” [in the oases in the south of the province Oran; oasis Sidi Youcef, at the far southern border of Morocco; hot water stream at Ouargla], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1872”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: It is unclear from the original work in which of the studied localities/sections along the valleys of the Sutina, Batarelov and Vojskava rivers (4 km W of Sinj) the taxon occurred and in which not, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2011: 207) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lyrata Neumayr, 1869.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans l’Ohio” [in the Ohio river], United States.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (Agourai, south of Meknès, Morocco).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously published name Melanopsis seurati semilaevigata. This case requires the action of a First Reviser.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“La Zousfana, à la hauteur de Figuig et à Beni Ounif” [Oued Zousfana, at the height of Figuig, and at Beni Ounif], Algeria).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously published name Melanopsis eximia semilaevigata. This case requires the action of a First Reviser.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis seurati semilaevigata Pallary, 1928 and Melanopsis eximia semilaevigata Pallary, 1928 (simultaneously published; no priority fixed yet; see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“‘Ain Arouss” [‘Ayn al ‘Arūs, near Tall Abyaḑ], Syria).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary (1939) indicated an illustration (“Fig. 4”) of this taxon, which, however, does not appear as such in the plate captions. Junior homonym of Melanopsis seurati semilaevigata Pallary, 1928 and Melanopsis eximia semilaevigata Pallary, 1928 (simultaneously published; no priority fixed yet; see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans la Glina près de Topusko” [in the Glina river near Topusko], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“Ougarta, à 60 kil. sud de Beni-Abbès” [Ougarta, prov. Béchar], Algeria).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis semiplicata Neumayr, 1880.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis nodosa Pecchioli, 1864, non Férussac, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Stations 117 et 117his: Oued Bou Fekrane à 13 kilomètres de Meknès sur la route d’El Hajeb” [Stations 117 and 117His: Oued Boufekrane, 13 km S of Meknes on the road to El Hajeb], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as infrasubspecific taxon (“mode”), which is not governed by the provisions of the Code. Moreover, the name is a nomen nudum. Pérès referred to an earlier publication of his (Pérès 1938a), claiming that he had described the taxon there already. In that work, however, he only mentioned a subfossil and a “forme modifiée” of Melanopsis magnifica Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: It is unclear from the original work in which of the studied localities/sections along the valleys of the Sutina, Batarelov and Vojskava rivers (4 km W of Sinj) the taxon occurred and in which not, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2011: 205) considered it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lanzaeana Brusina, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Моквинскіе пласты, р. Дуабъ” (Seninski 1905: 62) [Mokvi layers at Duab river], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis acuminata Seninski, 1905, non Gümbel, 1861.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zvezdan, Crna Reka oberhalb Zaječar, Vražogrnac, Vrbiza, Sumrakovac, Šarbanovac”, Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Wenz (1929: 2878).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 85) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen actually derives from the original type series and whether it was the only specimen Brusina had at hand. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3013-659.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2530-176/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 86).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis serbica Brusina, 1893. Neubauer et al. (2014c: 16) introduced Melanopsis haueri ripanjensis as replacement name, following Wenz (1929: 2741, 2743) who synonymized Melanopsis austriaca Handmann, 1882 with Melanopsis haueri Handmann, 1882 and listed serbica as a subspecies of Melanopsis haueri.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “En Serchs y en Auzas (Alto Garona), pero principalmente en Isona” [in Cercs (Spain) and Auzas (Dép. Haute-Garonne, France), but mainly in Isona (Spain)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong to the subgenus Stilospirula by Dominici and Kowalke (2014: 148).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Jardin public de bou Jeloud, oued Masmouda, avant son entrée à Fâs el bâli” [park of Bou Jeloud, river Sakiat Masmouda before entry to Fès al Bali], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Du village de la Serre” [La Serre (?)], France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Save à Sissek (Slavonie) et dans la rivière de Zenica (Bosnie)” [Sava river at Sisak (Croatia) and in the river at Zenica (Bosnia and Herzegovina)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as a nomen nudum in Servain (1884). Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia cornea (Pfeiffer, 1828).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivières entre Plaski et Ostaria (Croatie)” [river between Plaški and Oštarije], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1882”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Petit cours d’eau à Sadjour-Sou, entre Aïn-Taïb et Alep [...]; Aïn-el-Bass, dans la plaine du Bahr-el-Houlé (Syrie)” [small brook at Sadjour-Sou between Gaziantep (Turkey) and Aleppo (Syria) [...]; Aïn el Bass, in the plains of the Hula valley (Israel)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller et al. (2005: 232) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis buccinoidea (Olivier, 1801).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Zousfana, à la hauteur de Figuig et à Beni Ounif” [Oued Zousfana, at the height of Figuig, and at Beni Ounif], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Séville; les bords de la petite rivière de Guadaira, qui se jette dans le Guadalquivir” [Sevilla; the banks of the small river Guadaira, which flows into the Guadalquivir], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The “var. minor [...] de Grateloup” as discussed by Bourguignat (1884) was never declared as such by Grateloup (“var. b”). Brot (1874–1879: 441) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis cariosa (Linnaeus, 1767).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Spring and creek next to the Wadi Raiyan Plantation in the Jordan Valley near the town of Wadi Raiyan and close to the mosque of the grave of Sharhabil Ibn Hassana”, Jordan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Palaeontological Institute and Museum University of Hamburg, coll. no. 4267.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, appears only in the species list of Paetel (1888). Perhaps it is a lapsus calami of Melampus siamensis Martens, 1866 (Ellobiidae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Since Heller and Sivan (2001) did not fix a type, the name is unavailable after Art. 16.4.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered a subspecies of Microcolpia parreyssii by Neubauer et al. (2014d).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis plicatula Handmann, 1887, non Brusina, 1874. Wenz (1929: 2674) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum. Listed in synonymy of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903) by Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary (1925) introduced Melanopsis simulata as replacement name for the presumed junior homonym Melanopsis arcuata Brusina, 1878, non Matheron, 1842. The alleged homonymy is, however, based on a reading error of Melanopsis armata Matheron, 1842 by Pallary. Therefore, Melanopsis simulata is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis arcuata Brusina, 1897.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 97) defined a “neotype” based on one of the specimens illustrated by Brusina (1897). It is uncertain, however, whether the specimen was part of the original type series, which would qualify it as lectotype. Nonetheless, the type fixation is insufficient with respect to Art. 75.3 of the Code. The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2974-620/1.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis sinjana sensu Sinzov, 1884, non Brusina, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis sinzowi Brusina, 1885. Wenz (1919a: 73) introduced Melanopsis tinnyensis as replacement name. Papp (1953b: 145) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis rarispina Lörenthey, 1902. However, Papp (1953b) gave the older names Melanopsis bouei spinosa Handmann, 1882 and Melanopsis bouei ventricosa Handmann, 1882 in synonymy of Melanopsis rarispina. While ventricosa Handmann is a junior homonym of Melanopsis ventricosa Neumayr, 1880 and thus invalid, the name spinosa is available and has priority over rarispina.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Izzatullaev and Starobogatov 1984: 1477, fig. 1 (15), fig. 2 (6), fig. 3 (5).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Type species of Melanopsis (Sistaniana) Izzatullaev & Starobogatov, 1984.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museum of Palaeontology and Geology of the University of Athens; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Graben zwischen Podwin und der Čapla” [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Am Fusse des Černjajev’schen Berges bei Suchum” [at the foot of Mt. Černjajev (?) at Sokhumi], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: On p. 221 Rosen gave the species as “Melanopsis sobrievskii” within the subgenus Fagotia. In the plate captions it appears as “Fagotia sobrievskii”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Mohrensternia Zone, early Sarmatian, middle Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Polițioanătal bei Soceni” [Polițioană valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “St. Margarethen (Burgenland)” [more precisely, it is the Zollhaus sandpit near St. Margarethen], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Paleontological Department, Natural History Museum Vienna, Austria, coll. no. 2001/0126/0049.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014a: 463) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis soceni Jekelius, 1944.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Casino, e specialmente presso le Gallozzole” [Casino, and especially at Gallozzole], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pantanelli (1879: 315, pl. 2, figs 4–5) re-described the species and provided illustrations.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Gassies (1871) only illustrated but not described the species. Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 97) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2999-645.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “soubeiranus” as mentioned in Macarovici (1940: 344) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In Nova Caledonia” [New Caledonia; no locality indicated].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for one of the illustrated specimens of Melanopsis fusiformis Sowerby, 1846 (pl. 221, fig. 9) [sic]. The name is based on an error of Pallary (1920b), who only had the French translation of Sowerby’s “Mineral conchology” from 1845 (not 1846) at hand, where figures were organized in a different way than in the original version. Fig. 9 in the 1845-version corresponds to Fig. 7 on pl. 332 of the original publication (Sowerby 1822). Newton (1891) had introduced the new name Melanopsis pseudosubulata for that specimen and another specimen already (Sowerby 1821–1823: pl. 332, figs 6–7). Since Pallary mixed up the figures, he considered Newton’s taxonomic separation misleading and, in order to settle the problem, introduced Melanopsis sowerbyi. Consequently, Melanopsis sowerbyi is a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis pseudosubulata.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Based on a specimen illustrated by Férussac (1823: pl. 7, fig. 7) as “Melanopsis buccinoidea var. γ) antiqua; elongata”. Note that Melanopsis sparnacensis was not included in the catalogus of Wenz (1929).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2719) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Rivière entre Ostaria et Plaski, dans la Croatie méridionale” [river between Plaški and Oštarije], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Spelt as “sphoeroidoea” on p. 78 but as “sphaeroidaea” on p. 73. From the description it is clear that the name must be “sphaeroidaea” (see Art. 33.2.1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “À Sacel, dans la vallée de Blahnitza, district de Gorjiu” [at Săcelu, in the valley of the Blahnița river, Gorj county], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2678) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “spinicosta” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2831) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Holotype (?) stored in the collection of the British Museum, coll. no. G 17908 (Kollmann 1984: 58).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Kollmann (1984: 58) classified the species in the melanopsid genus Megalonoda, which was there described as new.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Моквинскіе пласты, р. Дуабъ” [Mokvi layers at Duab river], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Papp (1953b) listed this variety together with Melanopsis bouei ventricosa Handmann, 1882 in synonymy of Melanopsis rarispina Lörenthey, 1902, although Handmann’s taxa were published earlier. The name ventricosa Handmann is a junior homonym of Melanopsis ventricosa Neumayr, 1880 and thus invalid, but spinosa is available and has priority over rarispina.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2718) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis fossilis (Gmelin, 1791).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not stated; unclear if recent or fossil.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The species is based on a single illustration, without description or any kind of explanation.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis spriata Chenu, 1859.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis praemorsa sensu Brusina, 1897, non Linnaeus, 1758. Wenz (1929: 2831–2833) listed also other misidentied Melanopsis praemorsa from the late Miocene deposits of Lake Pannon and the Pliocene of Greece and Croatia under that name, but it is very unlikely that all of them belong to the same species.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not available from Oppenheim (1890b), where he gave it as “mutation”. Probably by mistake, Papp (1955, in figure captions) designated a lectotype based on a specimen from Neumayr’s (1880a) (not Oppenheim’s) original material.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el ‘Ain du Khabour” [Chabur river near Ra’s al ‘Ayn], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “La Save au-dessous d’Agram; rivières au sud de Krapina-Toeplitz, et entre Plaski et Ostaria (Croatie)” [Sava river below Zagreb; rivers south of Krapinske toplice, and between Plaški and Oštarije], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Note that Bourguignat denoted the authority as “Bourguignat, 1879”. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] acroxia Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Der untere Lauf jenes kleinen Gebirgsbaches, welcher den Abhängen des Berges Kopitnig entspringt, am hochgelegenen Kurhause von Römerbad vorbeieilend, dessen Thermenabfluss aufnimmt, und in starkem Gefälle der den Fuss des Berges umspülenden Sann zufliest” (Tschapeck 1881: 105–106) [in the lower reaches of a small mountain brook, which originates at the slopes of Mt. Kopitnik, passes the kurhaus of Rimske Toplice, takes its thermal water runoff, and flows over a steep gradient into the Savinja river], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for a specimen of Melania holandri illustrated by Tschapeck (1881: 106, pl. 5, fig. k).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Rossmässler, to whom Bourguignat referred, indicated the locality only as “Palästina” [Palestine]. As the species was explicitly introduced for Rossmässler’s material only this is the type locality.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Kobelt, 1880 (figs 1899–1900), non Olivier, 1804.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Carniole” [Carniola, a historical region that comprised parts of present-day Slovenia; no locality indicated].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Starobogatov et al. (1992: 65) considered the species as a junior synonym of Microcolpia acicularis (Férussac, 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Suter (1893: 139) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Zemelanopsis trifasciata (Gray in Dieffenbach, 1843).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2521-167/1-5 (Milan et al. 1974: 97).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melania buccinoidea subventricosa Grateloup, 1828, which Grateloup (1838) listed in synonymy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melania striata Sowerby, 1818, described from the Paleogene (Eocene?) of the United Kingdom.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis maroccana striata Pantanelli, 1886 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “У карагачких жутим песковима” [from the yellow sands of Karagača near Vrčin], Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 212 (Milošević 1962: 23).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis dufourii stricta Pallary, 1924 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2496-142/1 (Milan et al. 1974: 97).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym and junior synonym of Melanopsis stricturata Brusina, 1892 (see discussion in Neubauer et al. 2014a: 463).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller and Sivan (2002a: 49) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis multiformis Blanckenhorn, 1897. Heller et al. (2005: 244) in turn considered it as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Moosbrunn bei Wien; Tinnye bei Ofen” [Moosbrunn near Vienna (Austria); Tinnye (Hungary)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “sturi” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2835) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “River Pinios [Pineiós] in Thessalia, Greece, between Larissa and Tempe [Tempón] valley”, Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Senckenberg Forschungsinstitut und Naturmuseum Frankfurt, coll. no. SMF 111523a.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “situssineri” as mentioned in Koşal-Şahin and Yıldırım (2007: 51) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Southeastern of Guelmin, at river Seyad basin”, Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Museo Malacologico di Cupra Marittima, Italy; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for the alleged junior homonym Melanopsis affinis Handmann, 1882, “non Férussac, 1823”. The latter name is, however, unavailable from Férussac (1823) but was introduced validly by Pallary (1916), who referred to an illustration in Férussac (1823) (see discussion of Melanopsis affinis). This makes Melanopsis subaffinis an objective synonym of Melanopsis affinis Handmann, 1882 and Melanopsis affinis Pallary, 1916 a junior homonym of Melanopsis affinis Handmann, 1882. Melanopsis subaffinis was considered as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei by Wenz (1929: 2681).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Kirchberg Formation, middle Burdigalian, early Miocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bartha clearly stated that the description was made by Lajos Soós.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Institute of Geological Sciences of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, coll. no. 3185.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dax, St-Paul. Mandillot” (Grateloup 1840, in captions of plate “Mollusques terrestres et fluviatiles fossiles de Dax”), France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis buccinoides [sic] sensu Grateloup, 1840, non Olivier, 1801. The name “sublucinoides” as mentioned in Glibert (1962: 141) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Invalid replacement name for the homonym Melanopsis taurinensis Sacco, 1889, non Melanopsis clava taurinensis Sacco, 1889 (same work). According to Art. 24.1 and 57.7 the name proposed at higher rank takes precedence. This makes subcallosa an objective synonym of Melanopsis taurinensis Sacco, 1889, while the subspecies Melanopsis clava taurinensis Sacco, 1889 is still in need of a substitute name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Férussac 1819–1851: Mélanopsides fossiles, pl. 2, fig. 3 (altered caption by Deshayes delivered with Livraison 29; see introduction for details).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “D’Italie” (in the original captions, Férussac had given the locality as “entre Saint-Germinin et Carsoli” [between San Gemini and Carsoli, Italy]).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The description was evidently performed by Morris (see bottom of p. 156 in Forbes 1856). Junior homonym of Melanopsis subcarinata Deshayes in Férussac, 1851.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: d’Orbigny (1850) gave “Antheuil (Oise), Soissons”, Pacaud (2007) only “Antheuil”. Deshayes (1825), however, which the new name was based on, had only mentioned material from Soissons (along with occurrences of Melania costata mentioned in other works), France.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Deshayes, 1825, non Olivier, 1804.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melania costata sensu Lamarck, 1822, non Olivier, 1804. Junior homonym of Melanopsis subcostata d’Orbigny, 1850. Pallary (1920b: 110–111) synonymized the species with Melania costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 88) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2993-639.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis subcostata d’Orbigny, 1850. Wenz (1928a: 120) introduced Melanopsis constricta nowskaensis as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Sriratzel Cromfel sur la route de Rabat à Casablanca; Temslott, dans les canaux; Agagour dans l’Atlas” [Sriratzel Cromfel (?) at the road from Rabat to Casablanca; Temslott (?), in the channels; Agagour (?) in the Atlas Mts.], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis subcostulata Pallary, 1904.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Several collection stations near Meknès, Fès, Aïn El Aouda and Aïn Chkef, Morocco (Pérès 1939: 140).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for a specimen of Melanopsis dufourii Férussac, 1822 from Dax illustrated in Férussac (1823: 154, pl. 8, fig. 5).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The description was evidently performed by Morris (see bottom of p. 156 in Forbes 1856).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “subgraellsi” as used by Pallary (1920b: 106) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heidelberg Formation, late Santonian, late Cretaceous.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Au pont de la Save, près d’Agram” [at the bridge of the Sava river near Zagreb], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii (Philippi, 1847).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis elongata Doncieux, 1908, non Férussac, 1822 (see Note 1). Wenz (1929: 2838) gave it as “subelongata”, which is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heller and Sivan (2002a: 49) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis multiformis Blanckenhorn, 1897. Heller et al. (2005: 244) in turn considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis costata (Olivier, 1804).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not explicitly stated but probably the same as for the species (“Tappah, à 3 km Est de Belad Sindjar et ‘Ain Haglan” [Tappah, 3 km east of Sinjar and Ain Haglan (?)], Iraq).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Chatma, district de Signakh, gouv. de Tiflis” [Chatma, district of Sighnaghi], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Adjipirdariaki, O. von Marasy, Tscharagan, [...] Sundi, [...] Chinasty” [Mount Adji-pirdariaki, east of Marazy, Çarxan, Syundi, Chinasty canyon], Azerbaijan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: D’Orbigny (1850) considered Melanopsis rugosa Matheron, 1842 a Melania and the species name a secondary homonym of Melania rugosa Lea, 1842. However, Matheron’s species was published earlier (August 1842 vs. November/December 1842; for details on publication dates of Matheron’s work see note at the beginning of the Reference section). Melania subrugosa is thus a junior objective synonym of Melanopsis rugosa Matheron, 1842.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aïn-Fekan, source d’eau chaude entre Mascara et Saïda; dans Oued-M’Ilouya, sur la frontière du Maroc” (Bourguignat 1864: 260, 262) [‘Aïn Fekan, hot spring between Mascara and Saïda; river Moulouya, at the border to Morocco], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis maroccana scalaris sensu Bourguignat, 1864, non Gassies, 1856 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Described and illustrated in synonymy of “Hemisinus Esperi” [now in Esperiana], based on a manuscript name by Parreyss. Treated as a valid name by Clessin (1890) and made thereby available (see Note 2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis aquensis sensu Fuchs, 1870, non Grateloup, 1838. Junior homonym of Melanopsis subtilis Brot, 1879. That name was introduced in synonymy but became available from Clessin (1890), who treated it as valid species-group name (see Note 2). Wenz (1929: 2804) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis petrovici Brusina, 1893.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coo: molto frequente in tutte e due le zone fossilifere” [Kos island: very common in both areas rich in fossils, i.e., between Antimáchei and Pýli and in the northeast of the island, near Ágios Fokás], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis subtilis Brot, 1879, which was originally introduced in synonymy but made available by Clessin (1890) who treated it as a valid name (see Note 2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Annandale attributed the authority to Nevill, apparently based on a manuscript of that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “D’Italie” (Férussac 1823 had given the locality more precisely as “entre St.-Germini et Carsoli, et entre Otricoli et le Vigne” [between San Gemini and Carsoli, and between Otricoli and Le Vigne, Italy]).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “Melanopsis subtuberculata Férussac” has been used as valid name by several authors (e.g., Wenz 1929: 2839), but was obviously not intended as species-group name by Férussac (1823). Esu and Girotti (1975: 251) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac, 1823”, which is not available either. The name subtuberculata became nevertheless available from Pallary (1916) who treated it as valid species-group name and associated it with an illustration in Férussac (1823: pl. 7, fig. 11). See introduction for detailed discussion about the names used by Férussac (1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Azpeitia Moros 1929: 192, pl. 4, figs 91–93, 95, pl. 5, figs 116, 118–120.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Alhama de Aragón, [...] principalmente en la fuente termal de las Dehesillas” [Alhama de Aragón, mainly in the hot spring of Dehesillas], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“subulatus”), but Melanopsis is feminine, which is why the name must be “subulata”.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis subulata Sowerby, 1822.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Из Бабиног Дола близу Скопља” (p. 155) [Babin Dol near Skopje], Macedonia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntype is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 1447 (Milošević 1962: 24).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Senckenberg Forschungsinstitut und Naturmuseum Frankfurt, coll. no. SMF 345712.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii (Philippi, 1847).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: After Cossmann (1909: 152) this species belongs in the genus Semisinus P. Fischer, 1885, which is an unjustified emendation of Hemisinus Swainson, 1840 (Thiaridae).

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: Fér.” mentioned in De Cristofori and Jan (1832: Conchylia terrestria et fluviatilia, p. 7)

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, found only in the species list of De Cristofori and Jan (1832).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les cours d’eau de la plaine du Bahr-el-Houlé, non loin d’Ain-el-Mellaha” [in the rivers of the plains of the Hula valley, near Aïn Mallahah], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Bourguignat (1884) denoted the authority as “Letourneux, 1882”, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author. Heller et al. (2005: 244) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis lampra Bourguignat, 1884.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously described Melanopsis taurinensis Sacco, 1889. Wenz (1928b) invalidly selected the variety as valid and introduced a replacement name for the species, but the taxon of higher rank takes precedence (Art. 24.1 and 57.7). No valid replacement name exists for the variety at present.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously described Melanopsis clavataurinensis Sacco, 1889. Wenz (1928b) invalidly selected the subspecies as valid and introduced Melanopsis subcallosa as replacement name for this species (junior objective synonym; see Art. 24.1 and 57.7).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Considered to belong in the genus Amphimelania by Wenz (1929: 2876). Note that Wenz gave the name as “taurostricta”, which is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “‘Erq el-Ahmar” [locality also known as Gesher], Israel.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Paleontology Collection of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, coll. no. HUJ 9016.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior objective synonym of Melanopsis vidovici: Brusina (1903) indicated it as the typical form of the species. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2512-158/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 98).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “tesselata” as mentioned in Wenz (1929: 2841) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2758) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis inermis Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot attributed the authority to “Titius (?) (Parreyss)”, probably based on an “in schedis” determination.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Cascade d’Imouzer d’Agadir” [waterfall of Imouzzer at Agadir], Morocco.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: Féruss.” mentioned in Adams and Adams (1853–1858: 310)

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, appears only in Adams and Adams (1854) without explanation.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for the junior homonym Melanopsis gradata Fuchs, 1870. Both taxa were listed as junior synonyms of Melanopsis brusinai Lörenthey, 1902 by Gillet and Marinescu (1971: 57).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Vražogrnac unterhalb des Einflusses des Alapin in den Timok” [Vražogrnac, below confluence of the rivers Alapin and Timok], Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis sinzowi Lörenthey, 1902, non Brusina, 1885. Papp (1953b: 145) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis rarispina Lörenthey, 1902. However, Papp (1953b) gave the older names Melanopsis bouei spinosa Handmann, 1882 and Melanopsis bouei ventricosa Handmann, 1882 in synonymy of Melanopsis rarispina. While ventricosa Handmann is a homonym of Melanopsis ventricosa Neumayr, 1880 and thus invalid, the name spinosa is available and has priority over rarispina.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Gropile Vulpilor près Titești” [Gropile Vulpilor (?) near Titești], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2568) ranked the variety as a subspecies of Coptostylus albidus (Lamarck, 1822) (Thiaridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name was only mentioned in a species list by Bogachev without description or illustration.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aus der pliocänen Dreissensiaschicht von Djisr esch-Schughr” [from the pliocene Dreissena layer at Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ras el Mà de Fès” [Ras el Ma near Fes], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as nomen nudum (as Melanopsis bouei tortispina) in Papp (1951: 167).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for Melanopsis cariosa sensu Tournouër, 1876, non Linnaeus, 1758.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Ручей Гяуре, колхоз им. 1 Мая Ашхабадского р-на” [Gyaure creek, Ashgabat district], Turkmenistan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der Dreissensiaschicht von Dschisr esch-Schurr” [in the Dreissena layers at Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis transiens Blanckenhorn, 1897. Pallary (1920b) introduced Melanopsis cerullii as replacement name. Girotti (1972: 232) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac”, which is, however, not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Bečić; Podvinje (Čaplja) [Čaplja trench near Slavonski Brod]; Novska; Kovačevac; Moslavina”, Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2520-166/1-2 (Milan et al. 1974: 98).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Geological-Palaeontological Institute and Museum University of Hamburg, coll. no. 4270.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Commonly combined as Melanopsis tricarinata or as Melanopsis dufourii tricarinata (e.g., Azpeitia Moros 1929, Glaubrecht 1996, Ahuir Galindo 2015).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Appeared first as nomen nudum (as “Melania tricarinata”) in Fitton (1824: 376). Junior secondary homonym of Melanopsis tricarinata (Bruguière, 1789). Sandberger (1870: 55) considered this species as a junior synonym of Pleurocera strombiforme (Schlotheim, 1820) (Pleuroceridae).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “New Zealand, Bay of Islands, Waitanga Falls”, New Zealand.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally the gender was indicated as masculine (“trifasciatus”), but Melanopsis is feminine, which is why the name must be “trifasciata”. Type species of Zemelanopsis Finlay, 1926. The name “bifasciata” as mentioned in Pallary (1926a: 76) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum (Brusina apparently considered the term self-explanatory). Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum (Brusina apparently considered the term self-explanatory). Brusina (1903) introduced several varieties with this name, apparently considering it only a descriptive term. Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Vallée de la Cettina” [Cetina river valley], Croatia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Wenz (1929: 2734) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis geniculata Brusina, 1874.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, “in schedis” name from Tarnier listed in synonymy of Melania buccinoidea (Olivier, 1801) by Brot (1879).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Suita e Burrelit, prerja e Zallit të Gërmanit” [at Burrel, outcrop at the river Zalli të Germanit], Albania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 98) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2973-619.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: ” mentioned in De Cristofori and Jan (1832: Conchylia terrestria et fluviatilia, p. 7)

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, only mentioned in a species list by De Cristofori and Jan (1832).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Uferstellen der Sann bei Römerbad” (Tschapeck 1881: 102) [riversides of the Savinja river near Rimske Toplice], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for a specimen of Melania holandri illustrated by Tschapeck (1881: 102, pl. 5, fig. d).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “У врчинском хатару (долини потока Карагача)” [from Karagača river valley near Vrčin], Serbia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Perhaps stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, but not mentioned in the catalogue of Milošević (1962).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “See von Ta-li-fu (Yünnan)” [Lake Er Hai, Yunnan province], China.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis tuberculata Pavlović, 1927. Probably not a Melanopsidae.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Esu and Girotti (1975: 251) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of “Melanopsis affinis Férussac”, which is not an available name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced in synonymy of Melania buccinoidea by Brot (1879), referring to an “in schedis” name by Parreyss (see Note 2).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Stated to be uncertain by Philippi (1887, p. 40): “vermutlich bei Lebu oder Tubul gefunden” [probably found near Lebu or Tubul, Región del Biobío], Chile.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Pallary (1916) introduced this replacement for the presumed secondary homonym Melanopsis obesa (Philippi, 1887), non Gassies, 1856. Despite a valid nomenclatural act, the name is hardly useful because Philippi’s species is certainly no Melanopsidae.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “tuneata” as mentioned in Chevallier (1969: 286) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Station 31. Daïa Afourgagh près d’Annosseur. Station 144. Oued Sidi Raba à 6 kilomètres environ en amont de son confluent avec le Bou-Regreg” [Station 31 at Dayat Afergagh near Anosseur; station 144 at Oued Sidi Raho, approximately 6 km upstream of its confluence with the Bou Regreg], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans le Karasu, affluent du lac d’Antioche (p. 33); environs de Samava (p. 49; there treated as distinct species)” [in the Karasu river, tributary of the Lake Anuk (also as Amik) (Turkey); surroundings of As Samawah (Iraq)].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Mousson attributed the authority to Parreyss, but there is no evidence that the description really derived from that author.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Original source.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Fischer-de-Waldheim 1837: 131, pl. 18 [in text err. as “VXIII”], fig. 13.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Described and illustrated in synonymy of “Hemisinus Esperi” [now in Esperiana], based on a manuscript name by Parreyss. Clessin (1890) treated it as valid name and made it available thereby (see Note 2). Junior homonym of Melanopsis turgida Fischer-de-Waldheim, 1837. Starobogatov et al. (1992: 60) considered the species as a junior synonym of Fagotia [= Esperiana] esperi (Férussac, 1823).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Moulaï Taïeb et Taourirt du Zâ (Maroc oriental)” [Moulay Taïeb and in Oued Za at Taourirt (?) (eastern Morocco)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis turgida Fischer-de-Waldheim, 1837.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not stated after the description, as Matheron used to do it for the other species. Although he did not denote an exact locality, he mentioned earlier in text the occurrence of the species in deposits situated “vers Vitrolles et Martigues” (p. 148–149) [towards Vitrolles and Martigues, France].

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “‘Ain Arouss” [‘Ayn al ‘Arūs, near Tall Abyaḑ], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis turricula Matheron, 1842.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Im Gebiet des unteren Guadalquivir” [in the lower Guadalquivir river], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Rossmässler (1854) based this new variety entirely on Melanopsis sevillensis Grateloup, 1840, arguing that “Grateloup elevated this variety to species level without reason”. Thus, Melanopsis turrita is an objective synonym of Melanopsis sevillensis.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis turrita Rossmässler, 1854. Pallary (1916: 84) introduced Melanopsis hispidula as replacement name.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Turislav-Tal bei Soceni” [Turislav valley near Soceni], Romania.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior secondary homonym of Melanopsis turrita Rossmässler, 1854 and junior synonym of Melanopsis turrita Handmann, 1887, for which Pallary (1916: 84) had introduced Melanopsis hispidula as replacement name (see also Neubauer et al. 2014a: 463).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Duab Beds, middle to late Kimmerian, Pliocene.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Окр. с. Мокви, Очамчирский р-н” [near the village Mok’vi, Ochamchirskiy rayon], Georgia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Schmalhausen Institute of Zoology of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine, Kiev; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis boettgeri Oppenheim, 1891, non Klika, 1891.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Berguent; Aoûllout; Ras el Mâ de Fès; O. Chkef près Fès” [Aïn Beni Mathar, Aïn Aoullout, Ras El Ma, Oued Aïn Chkef in Fes], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Из Южного Буга” [in the southern Bug river], Ukraine.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der obersten Melanopsiden-Thonbank des rechten Orontesufers bei Dschisr esch-Schurr” [in the uppermost clay bank at the right riverside of the Orontes near Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as “n. mut.” but clearly as a binomen and hence not infrasubspecific in the sense of ICZN Art. 45.6.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brusina (1903) introduced several varieties with this name, apparently considering it only a descriptive term; the homonymy issue needs to be solved by a First Reviser. Currently, all of them are considered junior synonyms of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903) (Neubauer et al. 2014d: 125).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brusina (1903) introduced several varieties with this name, apparently considering it only a descriptive term; the homonymy issue needs to be solved by a First Reviser. Currently, all of them are considered junior synonyms of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903) (Neubauer et al. 2014d: 125).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brusina (1903) introduced several varieties with this name, apparently considering it only a descriptive term; the homonymy issue needs to be solved by a First Reviser. Currently, all of them are considered junior synonyms of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903) (Neubauer et al. 2014d: 125).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brusina (1903) introduced several varieties with this name, apparently considering it only a descriptive term; the homonymy issue needs to be solved by a First Reviser. Currently, all of them are considered junior synonyms of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903) (Neubauer et al. 2014d: 125).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The illustrated syntypes are stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2511-157/1-4 (Milan et al. 1974: 98).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Souk el Hâd des Aït Souhab, dans l’oued Gough, et Tanalt, à quelques kilomètres au sud du précédent dans l’Anti Atlas occidental” [Souk el Hâd of Aït Souhab (?), in the Oued Gough (?), and Tanalt, a few kilometers south of the former in the western Anti-Atlas], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Schiraz et Persepolis Persiae” [Shiraz and Persepolis, Fars Province], Iran.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, listed by Brusina without any explanation.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 444) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis frustulum Morelet, 1857.

tp:nomenclature.tp:taxon-authority: Grimmer” mentioned in Brot (1874–1879: 12) and Clessin (1890: 676)

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, listed in synonymy of “Melania holandri” [sic] (Brot 1874) and “Melania holandri var. aequata” (Clessin 1890), respectively.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zwischen Pylle und Antimachia” [between Pýli and Antimácheia, Kos Island], Greece.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Willmann (1981: 171) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis sporadum Tournouër, 1876.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis ventricosa Neumayr, 1880. Wenz (1929: 2674) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as infrasubspecific taxon (forma below a variety), which is not ruled by the provisions of the Code. Moreover, the name is a nomen nudum; Westerlund apparently considered the name a descriptive term (ventricosior = Latin “more bulbous”).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les aqueducs de Séville et dans le Guadalquivir” [in the aqueducts of Sevilla and in the Guadalquivir river], Spain.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously published name Melanopsiscostataventrosa Bourguignat, 1884. This case requires the action of a First Reviser.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not indicated, but apparently the specimens derive from somewhere along the Jordan river or the Sea of Galilee.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Homonym of the simultaneously published name Melanopsiscariosaventrosa Bourguignat, 1884. This case requires the action of a First Reviser.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis nodosa Handmann, 1882, non Férussac, 1822. Wenz (1929: 2681) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis bouei Férussac, 1823.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Boesciwiese, östlich von Kohldorf [...] in dem von Norden, vom Balomberge hinablaufenden Seitengraben” [Poiana Boistii (?), east of Cărbunari, in the trench running down from the Mt. Balom (?) in the north], Hungary.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, appears without explanation in the text. Possibly, Schréter wanted to denote that it is the “real” Melanopsis impressa and not a variety. Wenz (1929: 2753) listed the record as a junior synonym of Melanopsis impressa.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Lalla Maghnia, sur la frontière du Maroc” [Maghnia, at the border to Morocco], Morocco or Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Nomen nudum, used by Matheron in correspondence with Sandberger (1870), who gave it as a junior synonym of Paludomus lyra var. calva (Paludomidae), which he described there as new.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Lovara di Tressino, Mussolon, Monte Pulli bei Valdagno” [Lovara, Muzzolon, Monte Pulli near Valdagno], Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2014d: 125) considered this taxon as a junior synonym of Microcolpia parreyssii sikorai (Brusina, 1903).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 98) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2502-148.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Dans les cours d’eau aux environs d’Ismidt, en Anatolie” [in rivers around İzmit], Turkey.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Not indicated, but probably in Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “In der ersten Thonbank des linken Orontesufers bei Dschisr esch-Schurr” [in the first clay bank at the left riverside of the Orontes near Jisr Ash-Shughur], Syria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced as “n. mut.” but clearly as a binomen and hence not infrasubspecific in the sense of ICZN Art. 45.6.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Zu Brunn, Inzersdorf, Rothneusiedel und Wien” [in Brunn am Gebirge, Inzersdorf and Rothneusiedl (today both localities lie within Vienna), and Vienna], Austria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Perhaps stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, but not mentioned in the catalogue of Milošević (1962).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milan et al. (1974: 99) indicated a holotype, but it is uncertain whether the specimen was the only one Brusina had at hand (holotype by monotypy, Art. 73.1.2). The specimen is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 3205-851.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The locality was indicated as number “85” by Strausz (1942: 63, 101), which refers to the Canthidomus balatonica horizon at Nyárád, Hungary (p. 23).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Neubauer et al. (2016c: 280) designated a lectotype, which is stored in the Croatian Natural History Museum, Zagreb, coll. no. 2501-147/1-4.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis fasciata Handmann, 1882, non Gassies, 1874. Wenz (1929: 2741) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis haueri Handmann, 1882.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: The name “vitzui” as mentioned in Pallary (1926a: 93) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Beni Mellal, dans l’oued Taguenout” [Beni Mellal, in the Oued Taguenout (?)], Morocco.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Milošević (1962: 23) indicated that the syntype illustrated by Pavlović is stored in the Natural History Museum, Belgrade, coll. no. 209.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis glabra Pavlović, 1927, non Brusina, 1874 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Martens (1874: 32) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Melanopsis praemorsa (Linnaeus, 1758).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Coast south side Wai-iti Stream”, New Zealand.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Stirone river section, between Laurano and S. Nicomede (Emilia)”, Italy.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Senckenberg Forschungsinstitut und Naturmuseum Frankfurt, coll. no. SMF 345834.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: See statement for Melanopsis martiniana rugosa Handmann, 1887.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Replacement name for Melanopsis martiniana rugosa Handmann, 1887, non Matheron, 1842 (see Note 1).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type horizon.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Heidelberg Formation, late Santonian, late Cretaceous.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Clay-pit North of the village of Bavel (province of Noord Brabant, The Netherlands)”, Netherlands.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Rijks Geologische Dienst, Haarlem, The Netherlands; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Glöer (2002: 79) assigned the species to Esperiana (Microcolpia).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Золотой ключ около Ашхабада” [Zolotoy spring near Ashgabat], Turkmenistan.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Zoological Institute of Russian Academy of Sciences, St.-Petersburg; no number indicated.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Guinea”, indicated in the previous part of the same work (“Conchylia terrestria et fluviatilia [...]”, p. 7; there, the name is a nomen nudum).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Suter (1893: 139) considered the taxon as a junior synonym of Zemelanopsis trifasciata (Gray in Dieffenbach, 1843). The name “zealandica” as mentioned in Hutton (1883: 67) is an incorrect subsequent spelling.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Illustrated syntypes are stored at the Geological Survey Austria, Vienna, coll. no. 1869/01/5/1-2.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “L’Aïn-Kadra, sur les hauts plateaux de l’Atlas, à deux mètres des Chots” [in the ‘Aïn Khadr, in the highlands of the Atlas, two meters in the Chott (probably he meant the lake Chott el Hodna)], Algeria.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Junior homonym of Melanopsis maroccana zonata Gassies, 1856 (see Note 1), which Bourguignat listed as well (p. 260–261).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Type locality.
tp:treatment-sec.p: “Aus einem Mühlbache bei Nassenfuss in Unterkrain” [from a mill creek near Mokronog], Slovenia.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Introduced for a specimen of Melania holandri var. laevigata figured in Rossmässler (1839: 38, pl. 50, fig. 666).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Brot (1879: 457) considered the species as a junior synonym of Melanopsis brevis Morelet, 1857 (which is a junior homonym of Melanopsis brevis Sowerby, 1826; see Melanopsis moreleti Pallary, 1916).

tp:treatment-sec.title: Remarks.
tp:treatment-sec.p: Originally introduced as infrasubspecific taxon (“subvariety”) by Nevill (1884), but made available by Paetel (1888) who treated it as variety (Art. 45.5.1). Paetel clearly referred to the description of Nevill.

tp:treatment-sec.title: Types.
